description: My favorite place to eat for great mexican.  amazing food and the coolest people!
author: jamy d.

description:
The people are terrible, and the food is terrible.

There is no menu when I walk in. The lady is extremely rude in asking what I want so I ask if they have tacos. She communicates this to the high af cook who throws two tiny corn tortillas on the grill. They start talking in Spanish and I catch a few words including "cochina". Google it.

I stand there awkwardly until they're done then go to pay, and she gives no instructions on where to put my card or a price. Turns out to be over $10 for these two tiny "tacos". I open them up and they're literally corn tortilla + a bit of meat + some chopped tomatoes.

Will not be going back here.
author: Allison O.

description: This place sucks.. I was at the beach and looked up Mexican food in the area.. I wish I would of looked them up on Yelp first. The food  had no flavor.  Just alot of pepper.   But no real flover. The lady was rude. I'm a new customer.. she acted like she was too good to be taking orders. And the cook is a joke., rude and yelling at  customers. while having a conversation on his phone.   I like to support locals. but I rather go to taco bell than this place.
author: Mike F.

description:
Came here just because I was craving Mexican food. I ordered a beach bowl, which is essentially all the fix-ins of a burrito without the tortilla. 

The food was ok at best, further the price was a little high (I paid $11 for my order).
author: James D.

description: This place came up in a search for carne asada fries. I thought it was weird that it wasn't on the menu available online. So, I called to confirm that they did in fact have carne asada fries before I left my house. And guess what........ no carne asada fries! Super annoying since I did call and was told that they were available. I have no interest in ordering from here because of that.
author: Angela T.

description:
John Carlos was the cook when I arrived. He got my food to me right away because I was starving and completely out of juice. 
The meal was good and plenty of it including fresh guacamole and salad
Very clean place.table and chairs  including the restroom. That shows me the food also is clean and healthy. 
I'll come back. 
Kmac
author: Kenny M.

description:
Came in and there where two people working, neither one acknowledge me or said hi even when I asked where to place an order (as it is not immediately clear nor is the location of the  menu).

Finally a staff member decides that I exist and asked me what I wanted. I got as far as saying super burrito with carnitas.. then he presided to ignore me until he nods that it's ready and to go pay. Note that he didn't ask me what toppings I wanted on it  nor type of beans or anything. 

I'm in a hurry so I grab it.  Asked the lady about Hot sauce she points me to the salsa bar where all of them taste exactly like the bottled variety. The food was mediocre and service shinned in failure. This is a poor excuse of a Mexican restaurant.
author: Angel M.

description:
El Beach Burrito? How about El B*tch Burrito. I would give this place ZERO STARS if possible. Between the restaurant layout, the food, and especially the service, this IS ABSOLUTELY the WORST dining experience I have ever had...

1. Didn't know where to order or pay
The only indicator of where this restaurant's overhead menu is is Frowny McFrownster (FMcF) half waving at the confused would-be (but shouldn't-be) customers. (Is she saying 'hi' to me? Is she telling me to go away? Oh, she's telling me the menu is in the way back where she's standing!) Even then, the menu was shrouded behind cooking vents in the furthest corner of the restaurant, and had more pages than there were TV screens - a perfect example of where technology does more harm than good. (Wait... still can't find the menu. Oh! There it is! I think I want the burrito, no, the nachos, no the tacos, wait... what were my options again? I guess I'll wait for the slide show to start again...)

2. Soggy flavorless food
I ordered the nachos, because you can never mess up nachos, right?! WRONG. There were not enough (stale Costco) chips. There was but one layer of sad (not toasted) chips, struggling under the weight of the watery beans and chicken (and NO CHEESE). 
My meal was so sadly flavorless, the food was crying, and the only thing to mop its tears were the thin layer of tortilla chips. 
I tried so hard to comfort my sad meal, my natural solution was to ask for more more chips! (Chips are usually free for dine-in Mexican places any how, right? Besides they're at the counter, with tongs, and bags, within arms reach of the customer). So I go inside for more chips and FMcF immediately snaps at me "THEY'RE NOT FREE". So I give my eye-rolling server the $1.10 for the small bag of chips, which contained just as many chips as my original $12 plate of sorrowful nachos did.

3. Found hair in my food - correction: HAIRS
My boyfriend says I have a special talent for finding hairs in my food. I think he's a little embarrassed at how often I complain about it. Well... today was one of those days. Once I sat down with the new bag of chips, I dipped into my nachos and... pulled a hair out! It was buried quite deep, but was short and blonde. (FMcF had long black hair. Let's give FMcF the benefit of the doubt and not make this dining experience any worse.) So I picked out the hair and tossed the contaminated bite to the dog. When I finally mustered the strength for a second bite... I found a SECOND HAIR. A SECOND HAIR BURIED EVEN DEEPER THAN THE FIRST.  I presented my furry dish to FMcF, expressing my distaste.  She initially refused to believe me, insisting she didn't see it. Then she offered "MAYBE IT WAS ON THE FORK". I showed her the hair was buried, I insisted this was the second one I found in my dish, and get this, FMcF said "YEAH I GET IT. YOU'RE TRYING TO COMPLAIN.. WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO... REMAKE IT?" First of all, the hair was definitely embedded in the food. Second of all, why would hair growing on your forks be any better? Hair should not be floating around (or be buried) in the food you serve. 

In the end, I was too upset to wait for them to remake my nachos, especially after being asked detailed questions about what I ordered (sorry, not sorry, but I was upset enough as it was and FMcF could have safely deduced my order by looking at my untouched plate). I walked away. My only regret is not asking for a refund first. Actually, my regret is not taking a hint from the lack of traffic and making the mistake of walking into El B*tch Burrito at all!

IN CONCLUSION. Do not mistake this places's cleanliness for godliness. The fact this place LOOKS clean is because there's no mess to pick up! People aren't going here because they don't want  Mexican food by the beach. They aren't coming here because no one likes Mexican food that tastes more flavorless than the cafeteria lady's leftover surprise. But hey, at least the cafeteria lady wears a hairnet.
author: Arielle C.

description:
This place has become pathetic.   

The employees take a break at 6pm and put a "We'll be back in 30 mins" sign on the door and lock it.  Then they sit there and chat.  Have lost business from me the past 3 times I tried to stop in.  Isn't this during the busy time of day?

I get the exact same thing every time and the consistency is all over the place.  Size, quality and taste is not consistent at all. 

Owner(s) clearly dont care about the customers.  wonder how long this can go on before the doors are shut.  Looks to be in terrible shape.
author: Johnny C.

description:
The food here is pretty bland and very overpriced for Mexican food. You can get a Mission Burrito in the Mission that taste amazing for less than what you pay at this joint. 

Large seating area, when I went on a Thursday for dinner no one was there. Staff was friendly but the food wasn't that good. Lots of other good Mexican places in SF.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Friends warned us.

Only thing super about my $10.75 "Super Meat Quesadilla" was that it was SUPER overpriced. All sour cream & lettuce; barely any cheese; and carne asada was like teeny-tiny rabbit poop pellets.

$5.95 shrimp taco wasn't worth paying more than $1.50, $1.75 tops.

$8.45 "Meat Burrito" was just rice and beans. No flavor. Shouldn't have paid more than $4.

Damn. $37 waste on bad food and lazy service when you see her sitting down at the counter by the window & he's sitting on the stairs looking at his cell. Heaven forbid they wipe down the tables & push in the chairs. That's what customers are for, right?
author: M F.

description: I don't know why but I keep coming back to this place. Food is great, parking not so much. A lot of times I have to call ahead and double park but that seems to work for me! Not the best burrito I've had but one of the better ones in the Sunset. It's also a great place to watch sports as they have a nice big TV for that.
author: David P.

description:
Review about sevice:

Service is absolutely horrible. 18 people in line and no one taking orders. Waited 10 minutes before someone came up and started taking orders. Ignored as if they dont want out $$$. Not coming here again
author: Josue A.

description: Basic burrito joint with low quality ingredients. Pretty tasteless. I'm guessing they use the bare minimum of seasoning on their meats. And weirdly overpriced. Most of the time the burritos are wrapped very loosely, like a little kid gift-wrapping a present for the first time. But it gets two stars for being the only quick takeout burrito place in the neighborhood and for always being empty, which streamlines the takeout process. Other than that, pretty horrible. Not recommended.
author: kevin a.

description:
I can get with this place.

The gentlemen working here today brought their A game. Good fresh salsa and really good carnitas. I ordered Nachos today. I was expecting a lot from this place just because I had gone to Sea Breeze yesterday and they shined bright!

I just asked for a Super Nachos with black beans to go along with the carnitas and kept it moving. As I waited for the food to be prepared I noticed that there were a few other folks enjoying their meals. 

There is a bathroom here which is nice. Not sure if it is open to anyone and everybody but having one available is a plus. You'll know how BEANS be moving in the body in such!!!! 

The cooler here has a nice selection of drinks. The freezer has some ice cream. Not the kind that I would want but a good option to have here for those hot days.

Two big TVs here for sports games. I watched some replay sports games while I was here.

My food was incredible!! The nachos had all the right portions of everything. From the salsa to the meat to the beans!! This place understands distribution and quality. This may be the first taqueria that I have been to in some time that has done this properly.

The meal was sensational. Oh, the menu is on a LCD screen as well. That is super cool! The prices are very respectable and appropriate for what you get.
author: Robert F.

description: Flavor is ok. Ordered one time and the people after got there food first. And my burrito bowl came out to be a full on burrito.? wTH!
author: Miguel B.

description:
I will never return to this place. Ordered a california burrito and it was at least 50% fries. I barely saw carne asada in the entire burrito. The quality of the food I would rate at 2 stars.

The salsa bar was pretty BASIC with the classic sauces, mild, chipotle, and avocado salsa. The salsa was decent, but not good enough to return here because the burrito was so horrible. 

Like others are saying in the review, they put very little meat and lots of fillers such as fries, rice, beans.
author: Andrew S.

description:
TL;DR: pretty expensive joint for mediocre-decent food that you can get much cheaper and better somewhere else.

I sometimes come here right before going to the beach since it's so close, but my trips will probably be coming to an end. I usually order the steak and prawn quesadilla which are pretty good besides the fact they're usually drenched in oil. I tried the carne asada nachos for the first time, and it didn't meet my expectations at all.. I was hoping for nachos with large amounts of toppings like most other places, but it fell short. There wasn't much flavor either, it was pretty bland... The steak and prawn quesadilla, carne asada nachos and drinks came out to $24.. Maybe I'm trippin but for a high price, I feel like we should have gotten a bigger portion, more bang for our buck. 3 stars for the convenience because it's right next to ocean beach, if anything I would only recommend the steak and prawn quesadilla. Just bring a lot of napkins!
author: Cassie T.

description: I'm 50/50 on this place since I've only dined here twice.  The first time I remember being satisfying, at the least sufficient, so when work sent me out to the sunset again I figured I'd have lunch here again.  Ordered the same thing, chicken burrito, but this most recent time it was awful... I'm fairly confident the wrap was old, or left out because it was all dried up.  Perhaps they forgot to seal them up the night before.  Wholly unsatisfying and just very dry.  In a city with so many great burrito options, you've got to step up your game!  When work sends me out there again, I'll probably look a little further for a lunch option.
author: Jesse G.

description: Came here for a little "midnight snack" if you know what I mean. Got the beef stroganoff with a side of the house bolognese. Chips were so-so but the food and service was excellente.
author: Max F.

description: The worst mexican food I have ever had. Overpriced too. I ordered fish taco and shrimp taco. It was bland. The fish was just seasoned with salt and pepper (andddd under-seasoned). Not even a drop of spice unique to mexican food was there. There was nothing Mexican about the entire flavor except for the fact that it was served on a piece of corn tortilla topped with slightly salted beans and tomatoes that seemed to have been treated to resemble salsa. Shrimp taco is same treatment. Let's move to the homemade salsa bar. WORST salsas ever. No flavor, lack or no seasonings. The entire meal was a waste of money.
author: Shinta L.

description:
This place sucks go to La Playa Taqueria on Noriega instead.

Terrible service, you'll wish you spent your time and money elsewhere.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I used to come to this place years ago and it was better. Since moving back to the neighborhood, I've tried coming here twice in the past few months. Both times I arrived around a half hour before closing and each time they said they were closed early... if you want to change your hours, change your hours. Don't waste my time because you want to get off work early.
author: Andrea T.

description:
We ate here after getting off the MUNI, arriving in town to start our vacation.  We tried to go to Outlanders but they seated multiple tables before us (I assume because we had suitcases and requested an outdoor table).

I should have known better than to try Mexican when I live in SD which is known for its taco shops, but we were on vacation and I wanted to live dangerously.  We ordered the super nachos to split.  It was annoying trying to order as the menu is on TVs and it changed screens every so many seconds.  

When we went to order the super nachos the person taking the order did not know what they were and looked confused.  I pointed to the menu and the other person working there explained to them what it was, which apparently is carne aside (maybe just beef) beans, lettuce, pico, sour cream and guacamole.  

The meat was not very flavorful, nor the beans.  The chips were nice and crisp.  They had a salsa bar and I tried the spicy salsa and the green chiles salsa.  The green chiles salsa had almost no taste and was watery.  The spicy was not very spicy.  

Overall it was a disappointing experience.  The restaurant was not busy when we were there )2 other tables full) had 2 employees working and there were dirty unbussed tables in the dining room.  Also lots of flies in the restaurant which may have been because the front doors were left open and it was close to the beach, but not appetizing when dining.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Last week I picked up to go order of a carne asada burrito and chips. I think I paid somewhere around $13 for it. The burrito was mostly rice and missing most of the other ingredients. 

I was left disappointed but decide to give it another go today. 

I got a super burrito this time and no surprise, it was just as disappointing as last time. Mostly rice, some beans, maybe like a spoonful of guacamole, and 3 tiny morsels of meat. It was just so dry and yes, you guessed it, disappointing. 

Here's my recommendation, go to Celia's, pay a little more but get a great burrito.
author: Sheena S.

description: This place is such a hit or miss. Just order super chicken nachoes. It's is all sour cream and lettuce, and the only cheese on it is melted into the container. What a disappointment. I don't know why I bother with this place.
author: Dawn B.

description: Just picked up my super junior burrito that I called in, and was charged almost $10. I told the lady working that their Yelp says a super junior was only $6, & she said the prices are 10 years old. Not only is the burrito over priced, but it is also super cold. I will not be coming back here.
author: Casey L.

description: The fish tacos are BOMB! So happy to have stumbled upon this place! Unfortunately they didn't have guacamole but the tacos made up for it!
author: Molly B.

description: I've called and been told that the Manager is named David but I am not able to reach him. I became violently ill off food poisoning from their food and they are being reported to the San Francisco Health Department.
author: Food F.

description: I really want to like this place because it is so close to my house. I give it a shot every 6 months or so since sometimes you just have an average food day. But it still is the same, expensive for a taqueria and not particularly memorable. If this was in some random small town in the mid west it would be the best place in town, but unfortunately this is the Bay Area so they need to step up their game to stand out.
author: Matt S.

description: This place is absolutely awful. I have lived in The Sunset for years. We call it desperation burrito, only time we have come here is when Celia's is closed or we are starving. Today once again we again are reminded of why we don't go here. "Super Burrito" was the worst thing I have ever eaten. The entire thing was cold upon opening, and the hot part was unidentifiable except for some non melted cheese. We didn't even finish the burrito we shared and are now worried about food poisoning. This place isn't cheap either, and when paying that much for something I expect it to be good. This was slop and clearly made by someone who hates their job. Stop insulting Mexican food. We shall NEVER return!
author: Michael B.

description: this place is the worse mexican restaurant ever. the lady behind the register has a huge attitude very disrespectful. i had ordered some nachos and the chips are stale they are old chips . the chicken is plain no taste at all. just plain nasty food and customer service is horrible.
author: Miguel N.

description: The burritos here are overpriced and lack flavor, and service is extremely slow.
author: Phil C.

description:
The staff attitudes are as lax as that of the Sunset neighborhood, which could either make you feel at ease and at home, or nervous about if your order was taken correctly.

The burrito itself was incredible. Crispy and rich. Even the extra $2.20 for vegetables (!) seemed worth it in the end because the finished product was so good.
author: Chris S.

description: THIS REVIEW IS ONLY FOR SERVICE! I ordered two burritos, one California ($10.50) and one super meat ($9.95). The woman charged me $27 and some change. At first I didn't think anything of it then I realized that things didn't add up. Thankfully I was able to get my money back for what I was over charged. Don't let the woman ring you up she will over charge you!
author: Robynn J.

description: Their service sucks... I didn't get the chance to finish my order and the girl that answered the phone decided to hang up on me after i ordered some of the food. Don't call in for food here!
author: Chris G.

description:
This place is the absolute WORST. Aside from possessing no customer service I've watched the employees mean mug my boyfriend and call him inappropriate names in Spanish not knowing I understand spanish. If they spent all the time they invest in making the customers feel unwelcome and uncomfortable they may have semi decent food.

Just go to Celia's down the street, their food is way better anyway. I wish I could give El Beach zero stars.
author: Em O.

description:
This place gave me really mixed feelings. My friend & I were trying to decide between a several other local spots, but ended up coming here because we're cheap. Bad move. 

I figured Mexican food can't be too expensive, especially from a place called "El Beach Burrito", but we were so wrong. Their regular burrito costs $7.45 and is just that, regular. The chicken was pretty flavorful, but I don't think it could pass for a gourmet burrito for that price. I got the chorizo and egg breakfast burrito, also for $7.45, and it was alright. 

They charge $2.25 for Jarritos and $1.95 for a 99cent Arizona. Also, chips cost $1, which personally insulted my friend who happens to be Mexican. 

At least they had a colorful and decently clean bathroom and the ladies behind the counter were super nice and friendly to us.

Also, it never seems like anyone intends to come here, but instead walks in by default because Juadahlicious is out of acai or other places are too busy.

I will never make the mistake of coming back here to buy mediocre, overpriced burritos.
author: Erika S.

description: Man and woman behind the counter were rude and extremely slow. I ordered a chicken super burrito which was basically only beans, rice, guacamole and sour creme with tiny pieces of chicken scattered towards the bottom. Burrito cost me $10.50. This place is the worst
author: David f.

description: Finally had enough of the staff attitude at this place. Jerks. I can get a mid-grade burrito somewhere else.
author: K R.

description:
Food was way too expensive for what it's worth
Workers were lazy and slow
Food looked undercooked
Never order seafood from this place!
*MOST IMPORTANTLY THEIR HYGIENE IS NON-EXISTENT, they have horrible habits!
NEVER AGAIN FOR ME.
author: Tina C.

description: I just ordered a veggie burrito and ordered it super. My burrito was $11 and was at least half rice and I don't think I found any cheese or guacamole in my burrito.....Don't waste your money.
author: Amy G.

description: This was about to be my first time going. I came at 8:40pm and they said they were closed. They close at 9pm. Either change the hours or let the public order food. I also showed up with two regulars who live in the area. Major let down.
author: Leonard D.

description:
TL;DR 
con: Sub-par customer service, understaffed, expensive meal.
pro: Decent serving size, pretty tasty, sit down location.

I went here with a couple of homies since this was the closest burrito joint. The vibe and atmosphere was chill and we had a table to sit down at. It was a hot day and i decided to get a regular chicken burrito with an ice cold Arizona green tea to go along with it. You know how Arizona green tea is a dollar everywhere you go right? Well, here at Beach Burrito, it's $2 even though the can says $1. I didn't know this until the lady at the checkout counter told me in an apologetic voice that "sorry, it's the boss' decision"... To me, that's deception and just shady business.

Other than that, the burrito that i got was tasty albeit expensive. A regular burrito here costs as much as, if not more, than a super burrito elsewhere. The place was understaffed and I had to wait a relatively long time for my burrito. Overall, the burrito left me full but I'm still disappointed at the price and service.

I've definitely experienced better and won't be eating here again.
author: Wing C.

description:
overpriced surf & turf burrito..originally menu stated $12.95 then lady asked if i wanted guac, cheese & sour cream which would make it a 'super' burrito. i understand it would cost extra but at checkout, the burrito came out to $15.70. For that price, i could have had the surf & turf fajitas at celia's by the beach next block over (it's roughly $17-$20 there with actual table service & delicious food). my usual go to place is El burrito express on taraval but they're closed sundays so gave this place a go. The same $16 price would get me a el macho burrito from el burrito express (which is a double length super meat burrito good to share with 2 ppl)
I didn't even get any chips either...does that cost extra????

parking is a pain in ass too.
author: Yolanda L.

description:
Worst chips I've ever had in my life, plus they're extra!
Cheap with small servings.

Burrito 3/5
Chips 0/5
Setting 4/5
Service 3/5
Serving size 2/5
author: Calvin W.

description:
Not bad. Meat wasn't dry. Rice was a bit bland. Not overly salted (I hate when restaurants do this). Had a variety of tortillas. Chips were crispy. Salsa needs improvement 2 starts for that. Green salsa was sweet and hot. The darker roasted salsa was the best, but having tasted superior salsas not enough to give 3 stars. 

If you live on irving close than a trip to the mission. Go to the mission.
author: Attic F.

description: I can't understand why they are so unfriendly here , it's a laid back neighborhood , and not super busy ..food is only so so
author: kim h.

description: Quality place owned by a quality native San Franciscan.  They use the best meat - legit, high end stuff (even their tofu!).  I'm happy to pay a little more knowing I'm getting the best fish or steak, and not Taco Bell quality Mexican food.
author: Brittany R.

description:
This place is ridiculous! Every time our family of 6 has ordered take out here (at least 15 times) they have gotten at least one thing wrong with our extremely over priced order...but we continued to go back because it wasn't terrible and it's convenient...today I dragged my cranky kid out of the house with the promise of burritos only to find at 5:30 they were closed! There was a hand written sign posted that said "we are on a break. Back at 5:45" Are you serious?! You close the entire place at dinner time?!  
That was the last straw for me. I will not be going my back.
author: Katie N.

description: Enjoyable place and I love the food here! Great decor too...Love it!!! But honestly I only come here for the food...Why would you come here for anything else? Gimme a break its a Burrito Spot not a Bistro!!! The Carne Asada is on point, seasoned to perfection, I always get the Platos. The employees are always friendly w/ me!
author: Erick C.

description: I gave it three tries... And it struck out. Very slow service and not friendly.  I tried eating in, taking out and ordering ahead and none of the orders were done without me reminding them I was waiting. Quality of the food once I finally got it would be 3 stars. Not worth it
author: Post M.

description: Hands down the best burritos i have ever had! I've tried alot of places in SF let alone the Bay Area itself and nothing and i mean nothing touches the burritos here! The meat is cooked to perfection and everything else added into the burrito is always fresh! You have a customer for life El Beach Burrito! 5 Stars.
author: Anthony M.

description: This place is horrible! Me and my friend ordered a California burrito, there were 4 people behind the counter not doing a thing for the first 5 minutes. Overpriced, terrible service, and nobody here knows how to wrap a burrito properly. I opened up the foil to see that it was completely covered with guacamole, will never come hear again.
author: Hayden R.

description:
It pains me to write this review. I love burritos more than just about anything, and I wanted nothing more than to have a dependable, tasty burrito in the outer sunset. El Beach Burrito in its current iteration is not that burrito.

I've eaten here a few times now, each time hoping it will rise above mediocrity but it hasn't. None of the ingredients are stellar; most are bland. That's about it. A bland burrito in a city that has delicious burritos in almost every neighborhood. 

I'm rooting for El Beach. I'll probably visit it again in a month or so because I'm a sucker for self punishment, and I want to be proved wrong in my current assessment.
author: John B.

description: Soo disappointed...staying close by and thought give it a try. GROSS...we couldn't see the tiny lil menu on the wall, no idea where to order, and then settled on the California Burrito...asked what is in it, told ingredients Carne asada but NEVER told us French fries was in it but rice and beans was extra!! Highly disappointed and do not recommend it evveerr! Wish could give a half star
author: Peggy L.

description: First time here and I was so disappointed with this place. Unfriendly service, long wait time (for one California burrito on a Sunday morning with NO line) and very mediocre food. Have to agree with other reviewers on here, my California burrito was mostly fries and hardly anything else. Carne Assad wasn't anything to write home about and all salsas offered were blah - some heat but no real flavor.
author: Jessica S.

description: Love their carnitas! Whenever we are in the area, we look forward to getting a super carnitas burrito. They cook their meat a little bit longer so that it is just the right amount of crisp and inner softness. They have excellent homemade salsa verde and hot sauce. The service is very friendly and accommodating. I always get food to go, but the venue itself has quite a bit of space to easily hang out with a few friends.
author: Gaby E.

description: Pretty decent burrito and definitely was a great place to be to beat the crowds after Bay to Breakers.  Nothing fancy, but a solid lunch overall.
author: Grace S.

description:
If I pay $12 for a burrito (and stale chips), I expect quality ingredients, ample portions, and something that tastes authentic and good. Heck, I'm okay with it being average...

...El Beach Burrito is food that is slightly above elementary school cafeteria level in terms of quality. The meat is okay, but in small portions, and everything else is dull - the rice, beans, cheese. The main issue is that everything in the burrito for the most part is filler - and tasteless filler, at that. The salsa bar is okay, but I came for a burrito, not condiments. The "free" chips remind you of stale, no-salt Tostitos.

In short, don't come here. You're better off walking a block down and getting something at 7-Eleven instead - cheaper and tastier.
author: Bobby W.

description: Always a line which is a good sign! Quick service and yummy good food for great value. Also can build your own which is what I love!
author: Sinead M.

description: I wish this place was better, being the only Mexican place nearby that's open for lunch ive been suckered into paying way too much for a sub par burrito. Bean and cheese burrito for $7 that they fill completely with rice when I asked solely for bean and cheese nothing else. Oh well my fault for thinking it would be better this time.
author: Michelle C.

description:
While not a rival to the best of the Mission, El Beach Burrito provides reasonably good Mexican fare in the Sunset.

A friendly and casual place, El Beach Burrito is not trying to be creative, just to put out some solid Mexican at a reasonable price.  The sizeable super veggie nachos feature sautéed zucchini, squash, onions, and bell peppers and pack a nice, spicy punch.  What the burritos lack in flavor they make up for in size.  The chicken burrito is good, but lacking in the intense flavors that a true Mission-style burrito would deliver.  Another variable is the tortilla chips:  they vary from good and fresh to tasting like they came from Costco.

Depending on when you go, the service can be friendly or spaced out.

If you are in the Sunset with a craving for Mexican, El Beach Burrito will do; if you are looking for high quality burritos or tacos, hop on Muni and get over to the Mission.
author: CJ G.

description: terrible -$8.50 for black beans rice cheese and lettuce burrito  - terrible atmosphere, terrible customer service - no flavor at all. zero stars
author: Gigi F.

description:
Overpriced!!! In all seriousness, Mexican food is one of the cheapest types of food to order. San Francisco offers dozens of affordable/tasty dining choices. 

My "super taco" was $5 and it didn't even come with chips. My taco was mostly sour cream with a little bit of beef. I was disappointed. 

The only reason I went here was because, I was waiting for my smoothie next door @ Judalicious. I won't be back!! Damn cheapies... #bye #nothankyou
author: Andrew V.

description:
VEGIES & TOFU PERFECTION.  
I went looking for organic, vegan food and went to ?????? at the corner of Judah and 44th Ave. But the aroma of this Mexican restaurant drew me in. SURPRISE grilled veggie and tofu burritos, tacos and bowls. It tasted even better and it smelled. The were installing TVs for sports and social media feeds. Hope they're up and running the next time I go; which won't be long. Love it
author: Barry G.

description: Their food is delicious. I love love love their burritos and quesadillas. Only down side- it took forever to order and then receive our food. When we got there I believe there were 5 people ahead of us and it took us 25 minutes to order! Only two people were working- someone cooking the food and someone handling the orders/ checking people out (you don't do this together oddly?) . They might benefit from some more help.
author: Jordan W.

description: I love this place and it's great for vegetarians. Their black and pinto beans are both vegetarian, and they have lots of grilled veggie burritos and tacos. Chips and salsa are yummy!! Tostados are also very good. Come here and try them.
author: Liz C.

description: Relaxed atmosphere. Fresh food. One taco for $5. Filled me up. Clean and good food. Lightly seasoned. Add your own choices of salsas.
author: Frank Harmony T.

description:
Carnitas was dry, soggy and unflavorful. Prawns were ok. Guacamole tasted like they put food coloring in a paste/cardboard mixture. Would rather have had someone fart in my mouth than have what I ate here. 

Previous review about being proactive is very true. They'll just stand around confused at why someone is standing there and looking at them if you don't say something.

+1 star for funny (even if not intended) name though.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Starving from walking around all day - we hungrily descended upon El Beach Burrito.

I ordered the grilled veggie burrito on a whole wheat tortilla with pinto beans, sliced avocado and a big handful of jalapenos. 

The burrito was gigantic, and overflowing with flavorful ingredients. El Beach Burrito is far from being a Papalote, but I found my burrito to be filling, tasty, and the service friendly.

I smothered my burrito baby with red and green sauce and promptly left an empty plate.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: This place is incredible - granted, it's probably not as authentic as some "taco shop" in SD, but for where it is, el beach burrito brings the flavor. A little expensive, but worth the price. Their carnitas are always juicy and never fatty. Their portions are generous and their guacamole is so fresh - I could eat here every day.
author: Angela D.

description:
I'm sorry, did we all go to the same place?  I really don't know what all the one and two star reviews here are all about. . .

My wife and I were hungry and we decided to go here for some quick Mexican food.  There were TONS of different things we could have picked from on the menu, but we decided on something simple for both of us.  She got a veggie burrito that she really liked, and I probably the best $3.55 bean and rice burrito that I think I've ever had in my life.  Nice size, with a good portion of chips and serve yourself salsa.  You'd think that with just beans and rice that it would be bland--nope!  Real tasty, and with a little added salsa, even better.

This place needs to clone itself all over the place, but if it doesn't, it's at least near the Great Highway so it's easy to get to.  This was the best Mexi-food I've had in a while.  It had a nice, casual ambiance, friendly service, interesting music, and was really clean.  You can't go wrong here and the price is right.  Has the Matthew D. Stamp of Approval.
author: Matthew D.

description:
do not get a super carne asada quesadilla unless you want to pay $11.69 for no meat, a ton of lettuce and if you dont expect to get your hunger satisfied. seriously, the meat is chopped up so tiny it looks like dog food. i guess putting lettuce in a quesadilla is a beach burrito thing to trick you into thinking you are getting more than what it seems. after one bite, i was left with a watery river of "guac", sour cream and..water?

note, most of the menu is over $10 for bland, stingy portions.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Ate here once out of a desperate craving for a burrito and no patience to travel inbound to the Mission.
Definitely, not a Mission burrito, but the best taqueria I've hit out in these parts of town! (If you're in the Outer Richmond I would go to Chino's).

I got the Super Chicken burrito and the portion size was hefty! Flavorful and perfectly made.
On a second visit I got the Prawn Burrito. It was a bit too salty for my liking.

Things to note:
- Homemade salsa bar
- Must pay for Chips
- Lots of seating inside, but also some outdoor seating for those rare sunny Outer Sunset days
author: Olivia B.

description:
I don't like this restaurant. I've been here many times - I've had friends who liked it (for reasons I couldn't comprehend then and can't comprehend now) and insisted on going here over La Playa, and every so often I forget how bad it is and decide to give it another try.  It's always still bad.  

Yes, they give you a lot of food for your money.  The problem is, it's ridiculously bland and flavorless, and because there's so much food, it's really heavy and almost a chore to eat.   The salsa is alright, I guess, but it's not nearly enough to make up for how bland the burritos are.

There's never been a time when I was happy I went to Beach Burrito. They're just not very good at making burritos.  I wish it wasn't that way but it is.
author: Doug R.

description: We don't have many Mexican food choices in the sunset. This food tastes good 4/5 but it is really over priced. Portions are small for Mexican food.14$ for a shrimp and chicken quesadilla is an outrageous price. I usually walk down the one block, order and get it to go. The food is never that hot. They don't heat up the chicken on the grill. Save your 15$ and go to 711 and grab a hot dog.
author: Matt H.

description: The fish burrito here is the best I have ever had! The burritos are large and the service is fast, plus there are plenty of choices on the menu. I've tried their Carnitas as well which is as delicious as anything you'll find in the Mission.  Great for Mexican food lovers who feel "stranded" in the Sunset. I'll be coming back here often!
author: Eric L.

description:
I've eaten here many times and the food and service are good. Not a lot of spice but they're serving the outer sunset crowd which apparently isn't what that neighborhood is looking for. 

I asked for it and Jay, - this guy is really cool, gave me some jalapeno's to give me a kick. The salsas are good, one had a little kick- and they're homemade. So maybe if you ask for it they will spice them up in the future.

More so the burrito I got was delicious, shrimp super, low on rice - more veggies ROCKED!!
author: Rew C.

description:
Would definitely recommend the spinach burrito. The food was a really good portion size and struggled to finish the burrito.

I've heard a lot of people say it's expensive but I'd definitely eat here again. 

Went on labour day Monday afternoon on the way to the beach and it wasn't busy at all.
author: David E.

description:
It's a beautiful bright, sunny, and vibrant day in the sunset.  The strip of restaurants on this block all have lines out the door, except for this one...   It's got a bigger space than any other shop but it's empty.  Why you might wonder? Well I can tell you why.  The employees here are assholes.  I came in, looked at the food and prices. Noticed the food didn't looked appetizing and was overpriced.  
So I started walking out, and subsequently got a snide remark spit at me by one of the employees.  If they are pissed that no one is going in (if you look at them passing by they look angry) then talking shit to neighborhood people isn't going to help.

Yes we need burritos here, no we don't need shitty food, service, and attitude.  I suggest they sell to new management.
author: Koa K.

description: What a rip off! $9.19 for a regular burrito??? Never going back again. This is the Sunset, not Pacific Heights.
author: Tim L.

description: Just terrible. Paid $10 for a "super" carne asada burrito, they forgot to include cheese, guac or sour cream. Meat was gristly and gross, way too much rice and the flavor was totally bland. Go literally anywhere else.
author: Brendan R.

description: Pretty good, I may go back. The salsa is good, tacos good, very clean, and nice friendly employees.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Read the previous reviews and decided to try it anyways. Big Mistake

Service: Non-Existant

Food: Super Burrito (1/2 Rice, 1/4 Beans, 1/8 Guac & Sour Cream, 1/8 Meat), Salsa Bar extremely lacking (No Pico de Gallo, 2 Salsas), Chips cold, stale and flavorless

Price: Given the terrible quality, very expensive $13 for Mediocre Burrito, Tasteless Chips and Drink (Jarritos)

Ambiance: Infomercials on the TV

Would not recommend.

If you are walking by. Keep walking.
author: Consumer F.

description: Stopped here for a super chicken burrito, but it wasn't very satisfying. For $9.95, I would expect a huge burrito with lots of filling, but got a very small one (compared with other "super" burritos I've had elsewhere) with not much chicken or other goodies and rice that was under cooked. If you look at their prices on the web, just be aware that those are NOT the current prices... it's about $3 more for lots of items now. I also paid an extra $1 to have a small order of chips, but they weren't very good either... not very crispy or fresh tasting. The only saving grace was that they have a salsa bar, so you can help yourself to as much as you want/need.  Also, the guy taking my money was nice and friendly.
author: Annie W.

description: I love this place so much. The staff is great and they have memorized my order. I get the chorizo breakfast burrito with tofu instead of meat on a sun dried tomato tortilla and it is the most delicious burrito I have ever had. The tofu is always perfect and the burrito is huge- easily worth the cost. This place is very accessible for vegetarian and vegan diets and is easily one of my favorite spots in the sunset!
author: Kelsi P.

description:
pass.  6.80 for a junior burrito served up about as cold as the service inside and weather outside

after ignoring me during the order process they were quick when it was time to pay.  

the kicker was how she upsold chips like a prostitute sells poonanny.  $1 she says, i say no thanks as she empties the chips back into the tray.....tease

its convenient and nice to have as an option though
author: Clark G.

description:
Oh god. I ate here a few months ago with my husband and we shared the super veggie burrito. It was honestly the most pathetic veggie burrito we've ever had - namely because the only veggie inside it was lettuce. Wtf. Are you kidding me? No peppers or mushrooms or even tomatoes and onions? It was flavorless and heavy and kind of gross, to be honest. Just cheese, beans, rice, and lettuce. 

So that was a few months ago. I forgot to write a review until today, when my roommate and her boyfriend, whom I hadn't warned away from the place, decided to try it out. They also happened to get veggie burritos, and they also proclaimed them the shittiest burritos they'd ever had.

My roommate's boyfriend is now puking his guts out from said goddamn burrito.

STAY AWAY!!
author: Carly G.

description:
Nah, I'll pass. Give me warmer, fuller, more authentic and flavorful burritos please. What everyone is saying about the service and the taste is correct (in that, it's not very good). That salsa verde at Beach Burrito is tasty, but that doesn't make up for the fact that the store closes early, the chips are stale, their minimum for credit charge is like 12 bucks, and they ladies at the counter ain't too nice. 

God, can't you move the mission a little closer to the west side of the city, please? Just this once?
author: Amanda C.

description: Warning. Do not go here. You will be disappointed. Dry food, overpriced, crappy service. Made us wait 15 mins even before they took our order and no one was even in line!
author: Dara T.

description:
A one star for service.  I didn't try the food.

There were 2 seated customers when I walked in and 3 employees.  One standing around with a spray bottle and rag shooting the shit with a customer.  And two behind the counter shooting the shit while one "worked" on some food that was on the grill.

No greeting, No be with you in a minute.  I waited and waited.  Said excuse me?  Waited some more and walked out.

None of the employees said a word to me even as I left.  Made me feel like I was trapped in some weird twilight zone episode where no one could see or hear me.

Like I said I've no idea how the food is and not sure I ever will, there are to many other places to try in this city to settle for such lousy service, on the plus side if they keep it up they will be gone soon and something new to try will take its place.

Last note I had wondered why all the other little cafe's and restaurants I had passed were busy and there were only 2 people sitting in El Beach "No" Burrito.  Now I know.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description: Pretty good burritos!!! A perfect filling treat before the beach!! Great horchata too!! Salsa wasn't as hot tho! Which can be good or bad ;) this is my first review too hope it helps!!!
author: Matt J.

description: One of my favorite veggie burritos in SF, especially awesome since you can grab it to go an head to the beach! The prawn burrito is awesome as well. Yummmmmmm.
author: Julianne M.

description: Two words: Overpriced and mediocre. Such a shame because this is the closest burrito place to our house and it isn't good at all. Every time we go here I feel I could've made a better burrito/taco at home, plus it doesn't help that their prices are higher than your usual burrito spots.
author: Frances R.

description: I ordered the grilled tofu burrito. There was rice, black beans and grilled tofu.  I added some salsa from the tasty salsa bar.  The service was fast, the food fresh and delicious.  I had my reservations ordering grilled tofu from a burrito place but I was pleasantly surprised!  I'll be back!
author: Diana M.

description: After spending 30 dollars on two burritos and some extras I was really looking forward to a hearty steak burrito in the Set with a good friend.  After a charge for chips and salsa were added to the total I reluctantly still tipped 3 bucks in the tip jar thinking well hey its not the workers who make the prices up so why should I sub the cost of the  chip money out of the workers tips that I'm donating, especially for something ALL Mexican places practically smother you in as a mini snack to eat before the awesome authentic taste that comes along with spices and meats such as Asada, Barbacoa, Tripas and so forth....SF Burrito Joints have to offer.   Trekking back through a 10block hike through the Sunset I finally get to chomping my eagerly awaited Asada Super Burrito.  5 bites in realize I haven't hit any meat. 6 bites in I started questioning the Burrito and if they accidentally gave me some hippi vegan burrito by mistake. No mistake as the manager Elvira explained to me... The owner enforces a strict one scoop policy on all super burritos. Enraged for not spending 30 dollars on some burritos Del Taco would give more meat attention Elvira really went above and beyond to make the matter right. She was a stellar employee who turned the situation around.  I went into the call back inquiry full well knowing that the poor workers are thinking they did something wrong but I was very impressed by Elvira diffusal of the situation.  Elvira kudos to you for keeping me as a well tipping and appreciative customer however to the Owner: Shame on you sir for being so Barato with the meat.  You run an upscale spot in a upper class area. People don't want to be nickel and dimed for free chips otherwise elsewhere but they sure as hell dont want to find out the misleading and seemingly cheatfull formula you enforce to squeeze a dollar more from each so called valued customer.  My advice for what it's worth: is give people what they pay for at the very least. And if you want to stand out- make sure that your customer takes note of how generous the portions are. Establish a Rapport with your clientele and then you establish repeat business and free marketing when they blab to their friends how amazing their fav burrito spot is.  You should lower your own pay and give your workers a raise for dealing with insightful shoppers who feel cheated, because apparently Elvira told us that unfortunately those kinds of complaints happen on the daily.   Elvira has convinced me to come again. I hope to enjoy my food their one day and save the extra hour from having to go back and make a case.  Good day sir and buena suerte.
author: Victor H.

description:
This place is really average. 

I ordered a super meat burrito with chicken asado (chicken, beans, rice, salsa, guac, and cheese). The guac is nice and they do add a lot of it in it. The chicken was pretty good as well. They do have some chips, but really, they are stale. 

The horchata and cantaloupe agua fresca was really good too. I got the horchata, but I do wish that I got the cantaloupe instead. It was good!

Pretty good food. Not amazing.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Not much about this place is really "authentic" but it's not the worst Mexican food I've had. Their burritos are decent, but tend to get dry even with salsa.

The highlight is their tomatillo salsa! I haven't had salsa that delicious from anywhere! It's worth it to just get chips and try this salsa. Service is good.
author: Sara K.

description: Good breakfast burrito and a nice friendly staff. Everything tastes very fresh and quality. I'm a fan!
author: David S.

description: Not a fan.   First, they charge for chips.  I ordered a super burrito, its most expensive at $8 and you are going to charge me another $1 for chips?  Come on.  There are places with better burritos and self serve chips.  Next, I order two burritos and you get my order wrong.  Then, I ask for it spicy and what I get is a bland burrito better served in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.  On the positive side, the place was clean and the burrito was good sized.   With few options in the Outer Sunset this may be a last resort place but I would try to hold off for something else.
author: Kevin A.

description: I know they are slow... but its pretty good. Just try to be proactive when you are there- Make sure you go to the end of the counter where the cooking happens, ask if you can order something, and then walk to the register and say you would like to pay for the order. It seems so basic, but after going there and having them just look at people standing there all confused... I thought I would let ppl know what to do! :)
author: Zelason B.

description:
My girlfriend swears that these are the best vegan burritos in San Francisco. I was impressed by the number of choices, including several vegan/vegetarian choices, and the size of the burrito was unbeatable for the price - we spent $7 and got a huge package of pinto beans, flavourful rice, guacamole, and grilled veg. The chips were also awesome and their hot sauces - both green (lime/avocado) and red - were super flavourful.

I'll go back!
author: Malloreigh M.

description:
I stopped by El Beach Burrito today in hopes of finding a yummy breakfast burrito. All I have to say is winning! $7.50 for a veggie breakfast burrito with tons of guacamole. And $2 for a homemade horchata. The burrito was huge and so flavorful, their salsas were super tasty and that horchata mmmm. Plus free chips and unlimited salsa bar. 

They had TONS of choices on their menu and plenty of additions to make your experience all your own. 

I am very happy with my decision. Oh yeah, the cashier was doing a nice job of small talk, not taking it too far but being very nice :) 

And reggae music in the background.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
So one of my besties SWEARS by this place, and I finally tried it... and I have to say, El Burrito Express on Taraval will always have my heart (and stomach!). I got the super carne asada quesadilla and horchata, and the bf got the huevos... mexicana? something. I thought my quesadilla was ok - a little too much sour cream and I felt like the flavors just weren't there. The horchata was suuuper cinnamon-y and sweet. The bf said his dish was a substantial amount of food (a whole platter of stuff AND a basket of chips + tortillas), but nothing special.

I will say though, that this burrito joint is definitely more spacious and cleaner than the typical and one of the few places to dine at in the area!
author: Miss H.

description: Jeeesus, no. Even if you're hungry, don't come here. Service was mediocre. They don't seem to care really about offering quality service as seen from their sullen faces. Place was pretty much empty when we sat down. That was already a sign. Still, all the other places that were "good" were packed to the point there were people lining up outside. Paid $8 for a sizable portion. I ordered the special burrito w/ chicken & black beans. It included guac & cheese. Honestly, there was nothing special about it. I could only eat half until I felt sick to my stomach. Mind you, there was no taste whatsoever to this burrito. If I had closed my eyes, I probably could not identify what the hell I just ate. I was greatly disappointed. But hey, at least I left feeling really bloated in the most satisfying sense that I'm no longer hungry. Don't come here. Seriously, don't.
author: Ash Y.

description:
We wanted acai bowls at the store next door, when they ran out of acai we decided to leave to find food elsewhere and decided to give this place a try. 

I got the super burrito with spicy chicken and my boyfriend got the quesadilla with carnitas. Both were a lot better than we thought! Theres a sauce bar with salsas and jalapenos. I would come back if in the area again.
author: Marissa C.

description: Pretty decent for what it is: Mexican food in the Outer Sunset with lots of free salsa and pretty fresh ingredients.  Reasonably tasty carne asada burrito that I dipped into green salsa and a large homemade horchata, too. Docked a star because the pricing schemes are kinda strange and you pay extra for EVERYTHING - cheese, guac, etc. Honestly, it's too damn pricey for what it is, but with not many other options in the area, it's okay in a pinch.
author: Audrey J.

description: Holy shit! Went in there today and this place is a puppy abortion clinic. They seriously took 30 minutes to take 3 orders. I could have slaughtered a mexican calf, skinned it, and prepped it faster with one hand tied behind my back. Seriously, wet garbage.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
HORRIBLE, terrible customer service, and pathetic food. They won't smile or greet you at all. In fact, they just look at you rudely and make you feel awkward. The "bus boy" or whatever he is, accused my husband of taking the store's copy of the receipt. He wasn't apologetic or anything. He walked over to our table where we were trying to consume some of their disgusting food and said, "hey, you took the store's copy of the receipt," which wasn't true, but he basically made my husband stand there and empty his pockets to prove he didn't take it. It had a slight confrontational edge to it and it was sooooooo rude! No apologies or anything. There were only two people working, which is probably too many since they only have about 5 customers a day and zero repeat business. Go to Celia's on the next block if you want Mexican in the outer sunset or their burrito place on Taraval (El Burrito Express is run by Celia's too). 

Avoid this hole. I'm not sure why it even exists unless it's doing something like employing former inmates or juvenile delinquents - at least that would justify their  presence as well as explain the hostility.
author: michelle b.

description: 3 stars for their tasty spicy chicken burrito, friendly service and easy parking on a weekday. Minus 2 stars for a warm Jarritos from the fridge and charging extra for chips.
author: Katherine S.

description:
Though I've been checking Yelp for a while, I didn't make an account until now. But the reviews for this place warrant it!

I find the food to be quite good quality, and eat here almost every day because of it. I normally get the special burrito with chicken, and it comes out to $8.70 without the chips. Now $8.70 isn't exactly a steal, but they certainly don't skimp on size.

Customer service through my experience has been great, they are all friendly people and remember my order and make pleasant conversation in the downtime. Though I definitely have had to stand around for about a minute waiting for an attendant, they make the food pretty quickly once ordered. If it tastes bland (which I agree it will if you don't ask for salsa or hot sauce) grab some salsa verde which is supplied free at the salsa bar. It's delicious.

One star taken away because I have definitely had my stomach feeling weird on two occasions, once with some actual pain. But compared to the amount of times I have ate there total, it doesn't make me stop going.
author: Friendly R.

description:
That's right, just A-OK. 

The horchata drink is perfect, the super vegetarian burrito is pretty good, and I don't like too much else.
author: Deanna K.

description:
Bottom line: -Bland-

My wife ordered a regular pork verde burrito with cheese and I ordered a regular carnitas burrito without cheese. We could not tell them apart by taste alone.

On the plus side, nothing was over-salted. And although bland, the food was fresh.
author: Christopher B.

description:
I'm addicted to their "Super Nachos!"
I've eaten here serveral times. Since I've had the joy of scarfing down their Super Meat Nachos. It's all I think about.

I'm a pretty healthy guy, but the past month I've came here and downed their Super Nachos once or twice a week like I haven't eaten in days . The service here isn't bad, but for the area this is the tastiest Mexican cuisine around.

I don't understand the bad reviews, but there's always a scrumptious Mexican restaurant in every area. This is the Outer Sunset one!
author: Tip S.

description: Beef Tacos Rocked! Very good.
author: LJ E.

description:
This place rules. Seriously. I order a black bean no rice veggie burrito in a spinach wrap almost every time I go. I've also had their tacos, but not much else. However, I've taken tons of friends here and they all love it as much as I do. The staff is SUPER friendly and helpful. I love tipping them. 

Let's see... oh. The horchata (sp?) is phenomenal. They also make killer guac, which is the defining feature of a taqueria (in my book).

Their proximity to glorious ocean beach is also a giant plus.
author: Ruth R.

description:
Ugh this place is so deceiving.. you think it would be nice with the nice interior and that it is not "cash only", but hell no! I have been going here for years and I finally started getting into yelp so here it goes:
You never get welcomed when you walk in; in fact, when you walk up to the counter you usually have to wait awkwardly long for someone to engage you--which is a pet peeve of mine. It was really bad on my most recent visit (today) and there was NO ONE there except me. 
The wet burrito here is ok, however this place doesn't believe in serving dishes hot.. EVERYTIME I order something to-go its cold... so I eat in a couple of times and it is still cold! Warm at best, and the whole place is also freezing! On top of that you only get the most flimsy plastic eat-wear you almost just want to take it home since it is cold anyway. Taking it home also allows you to maybe add some of your own hot sauce since all their food comes out a little BLAND.
The price isn't worth it, $3.35 for a rice and bean burrito ONLY.. who the hell only orders that? I order it with some cheese and tomatoes (pico de gallo). I should of just made this at home because the cheese was just mixed white and yellow shredded cheese you buy at the store in a resealable bag. It also suspiciously tastes exactly the same as my finely shredded 2% mexican blend cheese by Lucerne. THEY CHARGE .65 for a little sprinkle and .70 for the pico de gallo.. my total came out to $5.11 almost $2 more than the places I go in the Castro and Mission etc. 
Paying, he asked if I had a $5 which I did not. He said just this time, there needs to be a $8 minimum... what a weird minimum! Put up a sign! Their card machine also fails a lot, so sometimes there is a lot of waiting while your food is ready.. getting even colder. They don't have water that you can just grab either, so on a taqueria level they also suck.
author: Tim V.

description:
This is easily the most flavorless mexican food I have ever had. I've been here a few times and have regretted it every time. Somewhere deep down inside those mediocre burritos is a hint of taste, though I couldnt tell you what that taste is. 
The prices are way too high. Portion size changes with every burrito, sometimes its HUGE, others(more often) its a teeny tiny disgrace.

 After 5 tries I think I wont be returning, but if you are looking for something less appealing than taco bell, El Beach Burrito is the place for you!
author: Nelson S.

description:
Okay, let's just start off by stating the obvious: no, this is not a place in the Mission. However, it is one of a very few Mexican places in the outer sunset, and I have found that El Beach Burrito far outshines their neighborhood competition.

1. Lots of choices, especially if you don't eat very many meat products. I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito, a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.

2. Decent size and not horribly expensive. Yes, you pay $1.50 more for a 'super' burrito, but even the regular burritos are large. Plus they give you a decent amount of chips and you can take as much salsa as you'd like from their salsa bar.

3. Friendly staff. The two guys who run the cash register have always been super nice and happy. Even the cook staff has always been smiling when I'm in there.

Those three things alone make this a far preferable option (in my opinion) than La Playa on Noriega. Plus I like the flavors of their burritos far more as well.
author: Alison Y.

description:
This place doesn't get very good Yelp reviews, but I thought it was totally fine!  

We walked in, it was clean.  This is good.  Then we went over to look at the menu and order and a cook said "Hi Friends."  That was cute.  I liked him.  Then we ordered - a veggie burrito and a super quesadilla.  And the food was GOOD.  And there was LOTS of it (I couldn't even finish my quesadilla).  They also had a little salsa bar, which didn't have the biggest variety, but what they did have were the two best kinds of salsa to have - a roasted red pepper salsa and a tomatillo avocado salsa.  

The only complaints/suggestions that I have are:
1.)  The counter woman wasn't half as rude as the previous reviews stated, but she wasn't a bowl of peaches.  I know you're a cashier at a beach burrito joint lady, but things could be worse. 
2.)  Salsa was good, but it needed some salt!  And I couldn't find a shaker :(

We'll be back though!
author: Rachelle P.

description:
We had a hankering for burritos and decided to check out the Burrito eater recommendation.  The closest one to our house was this one and we had been to it before.  It was not very memorable, but we decided to go there anyway as we were too lazy to drive very far.  In a summary, the food here is blah which is on par with the service.

I ordered a super burrito and it was slightly over $8.  It had no taste and wasn't even lukewarm. The chips were old tasting and hard. Though we arrived about 1130 there was nobody there.  For the half hour that we were there, only a few customers came in for to-go orders.  Apparently it is not very popular.

The front door was wide open and some black birds flew in.  One of the help had to grab one that was fluttering by the window and tossed it out. Of course, a bunch of its feathers drifted into the restaurant. They didn't bother closing the door which seemed like a no-brainer. The music was turned up way too loud and apparently was meant for the enjoyment of the staff and not the customers.  It was very distracting.

The cashier, a heavy set Hispanic woman, didn't appear to enjoy customers and was unfriendly.  She reminded us of a mannequin in a Halloween mask.  She is definitely a negative impact to this place.

It is unlikely that we will return here.  I would rather go to Chevy's - at least the staff has better customer service skills and the food is warm.
author: Robert J.

description: What a bland, boring burrito with not a decent salsa in sight.  They try to be a ghetto Chipotle, but to no avail.  Don't Bother.
author: Andy Z.

description:
If the beach burrito was the spot after last call at the bars....This place would be the spot....Because you would be too drunk to give a crap about you're eating...

The Burritos are bland and just ok....And everything else just fails. My biggest complaint is the staff. Primarily the lady who taking the orders most of the time. She is the slowest person ever and even rude sometimes. 

The Carnitas is good however.

Here's a tip do not go to this place if they are 30 mins from closing the food is rushed and the cashier get even stupider. 

I really wanna give this place 3 stars because it's in my neighborhood. But this place is below average. I'll Stick with Gordo's, Lavenida and LaFonda on 9th and Irving. 

Even the Burrito place on Noriega and 46th is better than the beach Burritto. 

I could make my own burrito for less instead of going here
author: M P.

description: We would have loved to rate the food, if we had even been acknowledged. Absolutely no attempt was made to take our money and give us food. The 3 people behind the counter just kept walking away as though we weren't there.
author: Angie D.

description:
Just like the other reviews, Beach Burrito is horrible.  Bland burritos with a side of rudeness.

I've been here a few times and it's the same bland food and poor service every time.  The only reason I came back is the lack of fast food in the area.  

After today, I'm never going back.  I stopped in tonight to get a burrito and was completely ignored by the employee who was taking the orders.  He was chatting up storm with someone else and wouldn't stop talking to take my order.  After about 7 mins of waiting I left.

If you're in the area and looking for some mexican food, I would suggest going across the street to Celia's or even better go down a few blocks to La Playa Taqueria over on Noriega, great fish tacos.
author: Mike S.

description: They messed up on my 1st order and gave me a chicken quesadilla when I ordered a veggie.  My husband went back to get my veggie and the only vegetable was zucchini.
author: Kathy B.

description:
The hubby and I came here for lunch after signing the lease on our new beach-side apartment.  I have lived in this hood in the past and was thrilled to see how many old faves remained and how many new options had popped up.  

I was excited to see a burrito shop a few blocks from the new digs but I'm sorry to say that we were a little disappointed in how bland everthing tasted.  I had the chicken asado and the hubby had the carnitas.  Mine was slightly better than his but both were pretty blah.  The only things that had a lot of flavor were the chips and they were way too salty.   Even the salsas didn't add a whole lot.

Maybe we just need to try other things.  Sounds like the chile verde is good so we'll check that out next time.  And there will be a next time given the proximity to our new home.
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
The key to getting your order right at this place is:

1) Have a pleasant attitude, definitely give a tip, because they do remember that.
2) When you order your food, don't just walk away, stay at the counter and watch how they prepare your food and what they put it in. 
3)Try and be a cute guy so that the lady at the cashier will come out of her haze and become charming and sweet (I've seen it happen).

+This place is the better burrito place out of the 1 of 2 burrito places in the Sunset, food and salsa are tasty (once they get your order right), you can pretty much find parking/right off the N-Line and it's open late (9 PM being late for the Sunset). 

-The price is kind of expensive, you have to watch the preparation of your food, not a good place for people who expect the staff to treat you like the sterling customer that you are, although I've experienced a couple smiles here and there.
author: Solitaire M.

description: Im giving this place 5 stars! here is why. The food is always fresh. Everything except tortillas is made from scratch every morning. That means no canned tomatoes and no powdered agua frescas! They use no lard in ANYTHING so even the refried beans are vegitarian. If you are a meat eater you will never find fat or grizel in your food because they buy good quality meat and trim even that. The cooks season the food gently as to not overwhelm those with a more delicate palate but make sure there is plenty of salsa,and peppers so you can add heat to your liking. This is a family owned business and the owner grew up only blocks from the restaurant. He hires a variety of people,pays them a fair wage and treats them like family. He contributes to the sunset community  in more ways than can be written in this review. This is what you pay for QUALITY!
author: j c.

description:
An epic show. An epic run. An epic burrito.

I'm pretty sure I know why this burrito was so good. I had just finished two epic nights with Above & Beyond in Los Angeles. And had flown home right after the second show to run Bay To Breakers.

I was slightly hungry. Slightly.

So you can imagine, that when I got my very well priced slab featuring a wheat tortilla absolutely jammed with grilled tofu, black beans and mild sauce I went to town. It was so amazing.

From the Adrenalin Room (http://youtu.be/HM6pd8-GjGs) to the Adrenalin Burrito.
author: Jason B.

description:
A disclaimer: I live about two blocks from this place, AND I hate to drive, so I'll admit that my fourth star has more to do with my laziness/being a somewhat captive audience than about the quality of the food.

Having said that, I think the food here is good.  Not great, but good.  The chile verde pork is quite tasty, and is probably the reason I do not experience the "dry burrito" syndrome several others here have reported.  The salsa bar is also quite good, and my wife really likes the green tomatillo salsa in particular.  

The service...huh.  I go here enough that I am greeted warmly, but they are SLOW.  If there are more than a couple people in line ahead of you, I would recommend a book or placing your order and then running next door for a smoothie, cuz it's gonna be a minute.

Good food, in the neighborhood, and I can lie to myself and say that by walking there and back I am burning off some of the calories in a super burrito.  Not for everybody, but good for me.
author: Brendon O.

description:
My usual burritos from Gordo's on 9th Ave. or the The New Spot in the Dogpatch. El Beach Burrito is just 3 short blocks from my house so i decided to give it a go as i was hungry, and thought a burrito would do nicely.

My brother and I walk in an notice it is deserted. Strike one. But still my stomach is willing to give it a chance. The lady at the register wasn't friendly in the least. She didn't speak English well, but she apparently felt like we were bugging here just by buying food from her restaurant. Strike Two. Okay so i finally get a super carne asada to take home, it is a little pricey, more than im used to and they charged for using a wheat tortilla. Foul Ball. The money could still be worth it if it's really good.

Nope. Strike Three and El Beach Burrito is out. A dry, flavor-poor burrito is what i got. Also they use a yellow-orange cheese that reminded me of a viscous Kraft Mac and Cheese. They were extremely cheap on pretty much everything, even the rice, resulting in a super burrito that was only super in name and price only. 

Stay away! If you're in the Outer Sunset, make the trip to 9th avenue.
author: Ala T.

description: Similar to most reviews, bad service, boring, bland food and a lack of interest in pleasing the customer is what you'll get here.  never seen a super burrito that didn't come with cheese, lettuce or less than a spoonful of guac and sour cream.  but that's what they gave me.  overcooked meat and salsa that has less flavor than the safeway brand i had to put it on it to wash it down at home.  all for the low price of $9+.  do NOT go here.  walk across the street to Celia's and pay an extra $2 and be happy.
author: Matthew L.

description: Do not eat here! My friends and I were looking for a cheap taqueria by the beach. We were excited to see el beach burrito so close to the beach. When we got inside the first thing I noticed was the extras in the corner. Tortillas, cheese, and sour cream were considered as extras and up to 70 cents more. I thought it was going to e cheap but everything came out to like $10. What I didn't like was that my girlfriend who is a vegetarian asked if the beans are cooked with meat and the guy who was making our burritos said "I don't know I don't make the food here." Ugh so annoying. I ordered a fish burrito thinking that it'd be a fun treat. When I saw him take the raw fish out to cook it was out of an old tupperware and the fish was grey and gross looking. When we finally got our burritos after at least 20 minutes all four of my friends and I were disappointed. It was dry and bland. Definitely a let down. The service was bad and so was the food-not to mention way over priced!!! Nobody come here!
author: Naila S.

description:
I only ordered takeout from here...

I called in to ask about some of the burritos and a young girl answered who had no real clue. She didn't know what was in the grilled vegetable burrito. She said "um, mushrooms." When I finally set my order for pickup later on and asked what the final price was, she said "we'll calculate it when you get here." How... unaccommodating.

The food leans more toward the bad side. Doesn't have much flavor and not very authentic.

The worst part is that there was a rock in my burrito! A rock!!! The size of my pinky nail! Thank god I'm not a very hard chewer or I would've chipped a damn tooth!
author: Carleen W.

description:
This place lacks the authentic feeling I get when I walk into any other taqueria.

Burritos themselves are mediocre at best.  There's no real flavor and absolutely nothing that stands out.  I'd rather travel a bit further and go to El Burrito Express on Taraval.  Or better yet, just haul my ass to the Mission.

This place is probably popular because it's the only one in the area and it's close to the beach.
author: Kimiko Q.

description: The register price was higher than the menu price, and the cashier did not refund me the difference. What a terrible way to treat your customers.
author: Paul B.

description: My daughter and I liked their nuclear (super big) quesadilla so much, that we went there two straight days in a row. Its so simple and so delicious. Thank you Guys!
author: Dimitri R.

description: We love Beach Burrito! Portions are very big, and it's a good value for the price. Best of all, everything is made fresh (nothing from a can!). Their carnitas are amazing; you never get big chunks of fat like at other places. In fact, their carnitas have spoiled me about going anywhere else!
author: Helen V.

description:
About what you'd expect from a place called "El Beach Burrito" located near the, yes, beach. Uncreative, mellow, friendly, casual, not great. It doesn't compare with the best places in the city, in the Mission, or even some better places in Haight and Inner Sunset. The service is anywhere from friendly to spacey/possibly stoned. We've had mixed results from the food: My girlfriend really likes their super veggie nachos, which has sauteed veggies (zucchini, squash, onions, bell peppers--which are imho a veggie not fit for human consumption but I digress--etc) They're a pretty good deal, though it also depends on which chips they're using. Sometimes the chips here are good and fresh, sometimes they seem (like some other taquerias) as if they came out of a stale Costco bag. I think they may even charge extra for chips now? Which would be worth it if the chips were actually good.  The burritos are hit or miss, have had a decent chicken burrito here but all the ones I've had are lacking a bit of flavor. Get the chicken verde or another meat with sauce if you can-- the grilled meats are ok but just underflavored. (Always find myself adding some of their free salsas to the burritos when I bring them home.)  Basically this place will do in a pinch if you live in the neighborhood, but don't expect something close to the best of the Mission. If you're really seriously jonesing for a high quality burrito or tacos, you can do better. (Like Underdog's on Irving/19th.)

But there's no sand or kelp in these "beach" burritos so that's a plus!
author: Craigary P.

description:
3.5 stars. The problem I have with Beach Burrito is that it's just a dark, lonely place. Not dirty, not scary. Just dark and dreary and blah to look at. Also, there's almost no Verizon reception inside so if I'm alone I can't even surf the web while I wait or eat. (Thank God for Kindle.)

The food, on the other hand, is fine. Generally, better than fine. I've ordered an assortment of combo burritos from here over the years and they've been consistently good. No problems. If you're hungry for a mission-style burrito you will be fine here.
author: Joseph H.
