description: Horible Service , Bland food ,that always seems COLD !!!  Dude with the pony tail should go back south, he has no respect for the sunset neighborhood and it's residents.
author: roger c.

description: Slowest service imaginable! And nine dollars for a burrito? No thanks.
author: Patrick S.

description: Another burrito spot with an okay burrito, but way overpriced! The burrito is not worth the $9 you spend for it here. Maybe I'd go back if I was desperate for a burrito and willing to overspend on it. The burrito is nice, but the price hurts!
author: Junel S.

description: Yes I have had better, I have also had worse. This place is convenient and everything is made fresh to order. They also give you a huge helping for a very small price. I recommend the tofu and veggies super burrito. It was filled to the brim with huge chunks of seared tofu and a veggie medley of squash, onion, pepper, and mushrooms, all of which are my favorites. When the hombre attempted to roll it, it barely made it, and then he crammed it into a tight foil package. Upon opening, it oozed out into a surplus of cheesy goodness all over my plate. I appropriately sopped its innards up with their crunchy chips and topped it with their house made fresh fire roasted salsa, which was very tasty.
author: M K.

description:
On our last visit, I knew I had to get some Mex-food loving. So I went here, and cried into my fatty burrito. The burrito was fantastic, and I was crying because in MA (the hellhole where I now live), there are no burritos that even compare. The salsa bar was pretty small, but the salsas made up for the lack of selection with their overabundance of flavor. The chips were standard taqueria chips: salty and greasy, leaving the perfect mount of unhealthy film on your fingertips to lick off. Mmmm.

So I ate it, felt really full, and dreamed about that tortilla-wrapped log of love.
author: Vanilla P.

description:
The food is WAY OVER PRICED, and lacks flavor.
I wouldn't say the food is disgusting, It's just not very good considering that there are tons of other places in SF were you can get a more authentic taqueria experience for a lower price.

The burritos are OK...the tacos are a joke.
I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.

The breakfast burrito is actually really good but thats about it.

Oh yeah...really stupid wall paintings with burritos and chili peppers with mustaches wearing hats on the beach...
author: Mario W.

description: In the beginning I wasnt sure on where to go eat at, I had a choice of going to Mango Medley, Sea Breeze or El Beach Burrito... So I had to pick one of these three places to eat at so then, I made up my mind I went right after El Beach Burrito because I had a craving for a Super Burrito... As I got in and looked at the menu that was posted on the wall so then, I ordered myself a Super Burrito w/ steak on it as, I finished up the super burrito like all the other burrito joints that I have been to... Now that I have eaten at El Beach Burrito for the first time for lunch I have to say that the super burritos that they make are pretty good and enough for me to get stuffed with a smile!!! Maybe not everyone will get stuffed with the super burrito that I have just eaten but for me is a yes...
author: William B.

description:
Came here when I realized Judahlicious had no real "man" breakfast, and when I crudely say "man"  i'm just talking about something with some meat in it. 

Needless to say, when I came into El Beach Burrito one early morning all I wanted was a solid breakfast burrito that would fill me up. Boom, got it. The burrito itself was decent, it was by no means amazing or to die for. It just did the job. 

The service was fast and the food was good. I can only comment on the breakfast burrito since that was the only thing I had, and I would go back, definitely. So the next time my girlfriend wants to hit up Judahlicious, I know El Beach Burrito has got me covered. 

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description:
Since we were next door at Judahlicious...we thought we'd try this mexican spot directly next door.

The woman who took my order was basically a space cadet...she wasn't really paying thorough attention to my order which I had to repeat a couple of times...I didn't know it was that hard to make a quesadilla!

Chips that came out of a huge plastic bag and shoved under a heat lamp....nah no thanks!

Food was not that great....I'm not coming back!
author: Jade B.

description:
I had the chicken fajitas for $6.95. I thought the meat was seasoned pretty good. They supplied a good portion for the price. 

I don't know if my judgment of the food is swayed by the fact I was Starvin' like Marvin having been drinking and partying. I needed some kind of food to soak up booze.

There are not many other choices in the immediate neighborhood. I am glad they are here.
author: Infodiva B.

description: Good little neighborhood eatery.
author: Anthony D.

description:
If you live in the Mission click away from this page. If you live in the Mission and you find yourself here go home. Pick up your PBR, hop on your track bike and head back. You can find your way by jumping on the N or just following what smells to be a mix of Taqueria and Urine.

Let's face it. In Sunset we don't have many options for Mexican and sometimes you really want some with out travelling too far out of your way. For that, I give this place 2 stars. It gets another star for being able to lean your bike up outside and not have to worry about it getting stolen or thrown up on as you would in the aforementioned Mission. But yes, if you have the time I would make the effort to go out to Papalote.

I had the special burrito w/ spicy chicken and it did the job. I'm full and still have the lingering flavor of guacamole and picante in my mouth so I can't complain.

If mediocrity was to take the form of Mexican food it would be a burrito from El Beach.
author: scott w.

description: A really good taqueria, especially for being staked out in the deepest reaches of the Outer Sunset. Spacious, clean, comfortable.  My cheese quesadilla was exceptional.  The wall painting of an anthropomorphic lounging tamale with entourage of dancing red peppers and pinto beans is exquisite.  Downsides are its a bit pricey and my buddy ate something crunchy that he insists didn't qualify as food.
author: Rick H.

description:
Like the place and all the choices of goodies that can be stuffed into a burrito but I am giving it only 2 stars because of the woman (hispanic) at the cash register.  I say hispanic because when I had been there once before I was helped by a caucasian woman who could not have been more welcoming.  This woman yesterday did not acknowledge me at all when I smiled and paid and actually looked away when she shoved my burrito at me, gave me a sour look when I thanked her.  Really bizarre behavior.  I know lots of folks will put up with a lot for good food but for me it is 50% food, 50% atmosphere and service and so I am giving only 2 stars.  We will see how she treats me next time, it might be the last.

Well I have been back twice and the woman has been friendlier . . . actually got her to smile once - maybe you have to get through her process.  So, I'm adding a star, maybe she will work her way up!  Still love that grilled tofu burrito, it is very dry and I guess I like that.
author: D. J.

description: There isn't a huge amount of variety in their salsa bar, but what is there is pretty good.  Their veggie burrito was very generous, and I also like that you can order the breakfast burrito any time of the day.  Lots of seating, bike parking right out front.
author: Jenn C.

description:
This is the WORST burrito place I have EVER been to!
 Dear future customers,
 DO NOT EVER go to this burrito place. 
It has horrible service, is WAY TOO expensive , the food is flavorless, and they assume if you don't order something straight up , they give it to you anyway. My mom and I are DEATHLY allergic to dairy, and they put sour cream on her taco, even though she did not ask for it!
All in all this place gets NO STARS, not even one!

Edited to add: This review was actually written by my 10 year old daughter.
author: Lia R.

description:
Really I give this place 2.5 stars but I am rounding up because the spicy chicken is pretty good (while not being discernibly "spicy") and the basic burrito ingredients are all in place. A couple of big "buts" (which I like, and I cannot lie)...

I asked for no guacamole (I know this takes some of you aback. Get off my back you judgmental avocado snobs), and I got home to find a rather large dollop of it smeared strategically mid-burrito. There are like five ingredients in a burrito and I saw them write down "no guac" when I said it. I was literally the only person in line at the time, busyness was a non-factor. I suppose I should be congratulating them for fucking up something so difficult to fuck up. Congrats, El Beach Burrito (do they really need the "El" in their name?).

Also the roll of the burrito was poorly executed. Way too loose, which left the burrito with a huge lengthwise crack running down it where the two sides of the tortilla didn't meet. All the juices from the chicken/beans/salsa ran out of the crack, and the result was me trying to eat something akin to a large wet bag. A pretty tasty bag though, I will concede. Kind of shitty horchata, the second half of the cup was really gritty like they actually made it AT the beach. I guess I should have known something was amiss at this taqueria when I saw a white person working there.
author: Trav W.

description: My favorite burrito in SF. The grilled chicken is great. The salsa bar is very fresh, house made, and tasty, with varying spicyness to choose from. I can't judge the rest of the menu because I am addicted to their grilled chicken regular burrito. The super burrito looks like too much of a mess. Viva grilled chicken!
author: M. O.

description:
My GOD! Good thing I decided not to come here.

We were thinking of going there to give it a try since we had this Entertainment coupon buy one get one.
Since right now is 9:45 AM and I am not sure what time they will open, I decided to call first. A woman picked up the phone.

EBB: Hello.
Me: Hello. What time do you open?
EBB: Ten thirty.
Me: Ten thirty? Oh ok. I have a question, do you accept the coupon from Entertainment?
EBB: I can not hear you, ok? Bye!
Me: Hello?

Hang up.

Wtf?!
Really the phone line was clear. I called from home, not from a cell phone. I have DSL running perfectly with the telephone line. (Note: DSL will not run well if the telephone line has static). She was able to answer me regarding the time but can not answer me as soon as the phone when I ask about Entertainment coupon!

I called back again.

EBB: Hello. (same lady)
Me: Why did you hang up on me when I asked about the coupon?
EBB: Oh. We don't take the coupon anymore. Uh... I don't know. I'm not the owner. You can call the owner, but the owner is not here.

I guess... whatever, I am not going to even bother going to this place whose employee is rude.

Here is what I thought though, I heard from someone how Entertainment coupon book works, is to charge the business owner fee to put their coupon(s) in the book. Entertainment also charges us $30-$40 for the book itself. Unfortunately, some business owners do not want to commit to the coupon they put in the book considering that they have already paid fee to have the coupon published, which also means an advertisement for them to get new customers.

Whether it is the case with this place or not, I don't know but the person's plain rudeness is just beyond belief.

I can not recommend anyone to try/eat at this place.
author: Oribel ..

description:
A slightly below average taqueria, but I think we are spoiled for good taquerias in the city. The bonuse that this place holds, is that if you're living in the Sunset, you now have a MUCH better option than Cecilia's across the way.  Again the minus, is that it is only ok.

I had their shrimp burrito, and still prefer the one at the taqueria on Noriega better, but after sampling my friend's chicken burrito and it was much better. We have been back a few times now and I have decided that out of all the Mexican restaurants below Sunset, this one is the best.
author: Dixon T.

description:
I dig this place for being in the Sunset amongst all the non-mexican restaurants.  Also, I double dig this place for having incredibly tasty veggie options!

Excellent tofu burritos, if not a little too big, as I never seem to finish.  Choice of tortillas, and healthy (vegetarian - non lardy) bean options, spacious place to eat with all your friends, and located in an excellent quite neighborhood near the muni and beach.

My new favorite is the two veggie tacos (grilled yummines!) that come with beans, rice, salad and quacamole when you get the extra "dinner" option (and cheap too!).

Don't know about the meat options, but if you're veggie and in the Sunset -- best Mexican place around.
author: Vicky B.

description:
Yum yum yum! I crave this place every day :)  They have friendly staff that works VERY hard.  This place is very busy but very laid back.  It is one our most favorite joints on Judah in Outer Sunset.  Their homemade salsa is fabulous.  Some of our favorite choices:

Carnitas (Roasted Pork) -ANYTHING- burritos/tacos/dinner plate/ nachos- YUM
Nachos
Tostada's
Grilled Veggie- ANYTHING
Horchada (Spiced rice drink) mmmmm

Very family friendly.  Great prices and portions.  Yum.
author: Lex B.

description: Yes its not the Mission, but for the Outer Sunset I am satisfied. Better than Gordos. Big portions, but you also are paying for them. They have lots of tortilla options and a pretty extensive menu. I have only ever had veggie burritos here so I'm not sure about the meat. Very clean place with good seating. Not always the nicest service, but again a taqueria in the sunse
author: Erin S.

description:
A middle-of-the-road burrito with bizarrely bored, disinterested service. 

I guess it gets props for being one of the rare burrito spots to be found in the O.S., but meh. They can do better -- they could refill the salsa bar, they could pretend they want to sell me a $6 meat wrap, they could give a shit I said black beans and not refried -- and they don't/won't aren't. 

And they know it.
author: Chris R.

description:
Great salsa bar.  
Giant burritos.  
Good combo quesadillas.  
Sweet Jarritos.

And about as far west as one can go to find good Mexican Food on the entire West Coast (longitudinally, I mean).
author: Jim W.

description:
Excellent food, the chile relleno burrito is killer.  Generous portions and the salsa is made fresh every day.  The staff is friendly and it's the kind of neighborhood business I love to support.  
This place is great and Jason is a good guy - so are Juan Carlos, Jose and Suzanno.
author: Michael S.

description:
This is a bit overdue, but my roomie having an unpleasant experience there as well prompted me to catch up on my reviews, starting with this one. 

Ok, so we moved into the area a little while ago, and both love burritos, so we were happy to have a place pretty close, even with a name like 'El beach burrito'... I mean you're a few blocks from a street called 'La Playa', not much of a stretch... 

So the first few times either of us went there went without a hitch, but the last time I went there, which will be the last time I ever go there, was pretty bad. I went up there with my buddy and walked into an empty restaurant. There was a woman in an apron, who I later found out was the owner, sitting at the front with a friend. I saw the line cook or whatever you want to call him back at sink washing some beef. I got to counter to order. He immediately came over took of a glove to handle the pen, and started to take my order. One of the few things I can do in spanish, is order a burrito, I find it usually helps get my order right. So I ordered, minding that he still had one of his raw meat gloves on, and he proceeded to put on one new glove and then pick up my tortilla WITH THE RAW MEAT GLOVE! 

Now I by no means am a germaphobe, but come on, especially right in front of my, that's obscene. So, once again in spanish, I politely asked him to change his gloves. As I was doing this the owner had walked over to take my friends order. I didn't notice, partially because she didn't get my attention, but apparently she gave me a pretty bad glare. The guy making my burrito was, nice and apologetic, he offered to get me a new burrito, and apologized which is all I ask for. A simple apology and remedy. As I am in the industry, that is one of the first things your learn. So he continued to make my burrito. As I was paying, the owner came up to ring me up. After I had paid, still with no acknowledgment from her, I brought up the issue, because maybe he didn't know. But  I know damn well she knows about health code, let alone common hygiene. 

I simply said, "I'm not trying to be rude, and I'm not trying to get anyone in trouble, but you need to make sure he knows' (this is where she interrupts and informs me she's the owner) 'that if he is handling raw meat, he needs to at minimum change his gloves, if not wash his hands thoroughly." She barely acknowledged me, no "sorry", no "thank you", no comp or discount, almost the contrary.  I mean this was an egregious health code violation, for which I would have been well within my rights to throw a fit and even call the authorities. It just shows poor ownership/management ability, which is probably why she owns a flailing spot called "El Beach Burrito"... her loss because, my roommie and I each eat at least one burrito a week @ about $8 a pop, your looking at a minimum of about $1000/year lost revenue. At a place like that, that could make a difference. Plus none of my friends or guests, and all the people that decide not to go because of this, probably a much greater number. But whatever, her loss, in such a fickle industry she should work on the basics.

Final note: My roomies experience consisted of him getting there at 8:40, when the close at 9, and being immediately and very rudely greeted at the door by the same woman with a "WE'RE CLOSED!" I recommend a business that requires less human interaction lady!
author: Parker H.

description: Employees are really friendly and the burritos are great! Could use more salsa :)
author: Concetta D.

description:
At best the food is OK. It's low rating is more because of prices & staff.

Prices are a bit steep for what you end up getting. VERY stingy on ingredients and more on the fillers.

Staff just doesn't really pay attention to details & when THEY get your order wrong look at you like YOU'RE not being clear.

There are other places to eat in the Outer Sunset, I suggest you goto another place to eat, because you roll the dice of getting what you want here.

I've sworn off of the place!
author: L G.

description: It was not the best burrito, but it was standard.  I ordered the pinto bean super and was full afterwards.  Definitely pretty big and filling.  Everyone was nice and I was served promptly.  No complaints.
author: Michael L.

description: Uhmm...NOT the worst Mexican food and NOT overpriced, and NOT bad service. I get the tofu burrito, but I don't know how vegetarian it is, I get a little sketched about them cooking on a grill they might have been cooking meat on. Now I'm not saying that they DO that but I don't know how considerate they are about grilling tofu on a separate and uncontaminated grill. So just keep that in mind if you're getting the tofu, they don't season it but it's SO good. Not sure how I feel about the rice, but the pico de gallo is super! Nothing beats great pico de gallo and I admire the salsa selection. Their chips are enjoyable, just the right amount of salt. And you get a generous amount of food for under seven dollars, and their sides are enormous. Five stars for delicious food and friendly service. Don't forget to tip, they deserve it!
author: Queso D.

description:
The Burritos are so so. They have a nice salsa bar. Its convenient, one block form my house. So why one star? Well the real downside comes in the form of the violent illness that comes with the 7-8$ price tag. Its like the sunsets very own version of Montezuma's revenge. Three of my friends, my room mate, and myself all got this fun and lovable bug. All at separate times. Why did we keep going back you ask? Because we are stupid. But no mas. We will not be taken again.

Yelp asks if it is good for kids.... It is not good for ANYONE.
author: Bret H.

description: I was born and raised in california. I have been to hundreds of mexican restaurants and taquerias. I have a pretty standard expectation of a burrito. I'm a vegetarian so for goodness sakes, you must have screwed it up big time if I can't enjoy the burrito because it's flavorless!! I can make a better one at home! My husband went back for carne asada tacos another time and was equally disappointed with flavor and that they poured beans all over the tacos, too.  Go to 9th st and irving to the taquerias there instead!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!7
author: Maddy B.

description: This is a nice neigborhood burrito place. The burritos are good and so are the nachos. I live near by and if I am hungry it is a nice place to go.
author: Nikita K.

description:
We ate, we left, I pooed. 

El Beach Burrito is a pretty decent Mexican place in the outer Sunset. Can't say that I didn't enjoy my overwhelmingly huge plate of nachos (super meaty nachos) - topped with grilled chicken (moist, but lacked a bit of flavor), guac, sour cream, black beans (just a tad dry, but the guac and sour cream made up for it) and lettuce. The amount was more than satisfying.

The BF had a super meaty carnitas burrito. The carnitas was better flavored than the chicken. Packed with rice, black beans, guac, sour cream and, of course, meat, the burrito was hearty and warm to his stummy. 

Downside of this place is the price. For nachos and a burrito, our meal came out to $16. Wow. I don't think I've ever paid that much for Mexican food.... anywhere. Boo for that. For $16, I wish I didn't have to poo right after lunch. Man... now I'm hungry again.
author: Teresa Y.

description: This place is pretty meh.  Nothing to write home about.  I'd rather go to El Burrito Express on Taraval.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
The  crabby woman who is at the cashier is..like the other guy said, a SPACE CADET. She asked me what did i order and i said, "super carne asada burrito". She charged me $7.95 or something. I gave her a $20 bill. Then five minutes later she asked me again, "What did you order?" 

i said i ordered a burrito then she asked me to pay AGAIN! what the fuck?!? then i said, "I PAID ALREADY. I GAVE YOU MONEY." and she started shaking her head. YO BROAD! i paid your ass already!! ugh.. And i was like are you serious??? 
I JUST PAID YOU 5 MINUTES AGO!!! then she checked her reciepts and realized that i did pay. and i was like, "I gave you a $20 bill and you gave me this amount back" and she still was shaking her head!! 

what a crazy woman!!!! is it cuz im asian and all asians look the same so she couldn't tell?

also, i asked one guy for a side of extra hot sauce (because their burritos are soooo dry!! but shame on me, cuz i keep coming back) and a few moments later, he would ask me again to make sure, "you want hot sauce?!" "uhh. yea?" and never got it.

The funniest thing is, I asked him to put black beans ON THE SIDE. when i got home, i found out he put them in a tiny salsa container (which seriously fits about 10 beans, max). okay fine, whatever. i took a bite of my burrito and taste a whole shit load of black beans in my mouth.  whaaaa, it's inside too??WTF?!? LOL

are you guys fucking with me on purpose or what? cuz if you are......... its working -_-
author: Nancy M.

description:
the reviews are true, el beach burrito is el bland burrito.

i ate the whole thing, but really it wasn't that good. derek went with me, and as a fellow burrito connoisseur he felt the same.

and yes, the prices were just too high for what you get.
author: Ameer N.

description: Very average burrito. Went in one time and the lady told me that they hadn't made any guacamole yet, but they had everything to make it sitting on the counter.
author: Andy B.

description: This place is good but not really awesome. Maybe I'm not the best person to ask, though, because I grew up in Monterey County, where the mexican food is super authentic, super cheap, and super delicious. I have yet to find mexican food in the city that really wows me (and I've lived here for a year and a half and, yes, I have tried all over the mission). So, for SF standards, this place gets four stars-- an overall average place. Clean, decent food, average prices.
author: Christina M.

description:
Eh.

People have covered this place.  Yes they have burritos, yes I want to eat burritos, should I appease my desire for burritos from this place that offers burritos?  Probably not.

So again, eh.
author: Dave K.

description:
Well they aren't the worst restaurant but they are far from good. 
I give El Beach Burrito a C-.
They are only in business because they are the only taquaria in the Outter Sunset. 
Also, Celia's Mexican restaurant across the street is a total joke. 
Celia's is rude and over-priced. Beach Burrito is just over-priced.
Beach Burrito is too expensive and the portions are small. 
I only go to them when I am too drunk to drive to the Mission dist. so I walk to this place instead.
author: Larry J.

description: I've never had such BAD customer service. I told the cashier that I only wanted a little bit of rice on my veggie burrito, cut in half and no chips. She just looked at me and gave me a nod and look irritated. She didn't even write my order down. So as you can imagine, when I got my burrito she asked if I wanted chips I said no, and then I asked if was cut in half she gave me that nod again. I got it to go. No surprise it wasn't cut in half., there was a lot of rice and it wasn't even that good. I have never experienced such rudeness and crappy service. Guess I didn't have a cute child with me or something. That place will never have my business again.
author: Kat J.

description: Great place to go for a quick, inexpensive bite to eat.  Never have to wait long, the staff is friendly, and the burritos are delicious. I also recommend the carne asada nachos...yum!
author: Lo Z.

description: Pretty good over all. This place makes a good burrito, and the people are nice. Just your general neighborhood Mexican place. If you go at the end of the day, the beans and rice are dry as sin. Lunch would probably be a better call.
author: Thomas E.

description:
I am cool with El Beach Burrito.  It certainly satisfies when in need of a burrito.  I don't think anything in the Mission is a whole lot better.  I grew up in the City and have eaten plenty of burritos from various taquerias in the Mission.  I think their vegetarian super burrito is surprisingly flavorful--and always warm, unlike most other taquerias.  

I can't really understand why anyone would say their burritos have no flavor.  They have chicken in a red sauce, tomatillo sauce, as well as grilled and all of them are tasty and very different from each other.  Their mojado sauce is some of the best.  It definitely tastes homemade.  My dad and both of my brothers love it.

I do think the food is overpriced, but I'll pay the extra $1 to have something this close to where I live.

As for the service, they are not overly friendly, but who cares?  As long as they don't spit in my food, I'm cool with an $8 meal.
author: Kandi K.

description:
We go to this place a lot because the prices are ok, quality is consistent, and people friendly.  The food is decent but not the best given the sheer options in San Francisco for Taquerias.   

One of their strengths is the number of vegetarian options.  Location is nice being on the N line and walking distance to Ocean Beach.  While I would never discouraged people from eating here (food is not bad, just bland) but if you want a really good burrito vs. a place to eat while in the neighborhood, you can probably drive to somewhere else.  (In the Sunset, El Burrito Express on Taraval is a much better option)
author: M O.

description: I used to love this place a couple of years ago. It's the only n'hood burrito eatery near the beach and they used to make decent burritos/tacos (I would've given them 3 stars).  The food and service has totally gone downhill the past few months.  Everything is super-salty.  Yuck!
author: T M.

description: My favorite grilled chicken burrito in half of San Francisco. Other burrito joints in other city areas get all the hipster hype, but el beach burrito earns it! The regular burrito is very filling, always well-made, never falls apart, and the salsa bar is always full of fresh-made spicy salsa! Yes! Never mind the prickly service or the annoying loud music. Their grilled chicken burrito is the reason to go.
author: Josh B.

description:
There is something about this place.  I mean you watch them make your burrito; you see them put ingredients commonly associated with burritos -- and flavor.  But upon taking your first bite, you can't help asking, "What happened to the flavor?"  

It's just not good.
author: Jacob H.

description: Food is good, but suggest eating outside if the sun is shining.  Inside the radio is always VERY LOUD.  Ate there one evening at 8:00 p.m. - they close at 9:00, but already dish-washing had started, so loud that we had to shout to be heard.    We left quickly.
author: Greg M.

description: Good burrito place. Not the best in the city, but one of the better ones in the Sunset. Food was fast and salsa bar wasn't too bad.
author: Shawn B.

description: I live down the street and I go here alll the time. The food isn't the best, but it's very reasonable and tasty. I get a veggie burrito on wheat tortilla for $7.45 and it's a lot of food. They've always been fairly nice to me and i've never had any issues. Overall I'd recommend the place and I go there pretty regularly.
author: B K.

description: I live near here so I go here. Their pork is very moist! That's all I get, Super pork burrito! Oh actually I have gotten nachos there too, they were good. I rather walk an extra 5 blocks to come here than one block to the other taqueria near my place. You Outter sunseters know where I'm talking about.
author: Karen T.

description: Meh burrito, I can forgive that for sunset, but how do you mess up chips?!?!!?!?!?!
author: Israel C.

description: one of the best burrito place in the sunset!
author: John R.

description: The fresh juice and friendly service earn this place its fifth star.  They remember my name, my usual order and always initiate conversation before ordering and at the register.  I recommend the watermelon or pinapple juice if in season.   The pollo verde and pollo rojo burritos are reliably delicious.  Jason is always up for quality, philosophical conversation, too.   I love this place.
author: Pedro K.

description: The best mexican in the neighborhood, tasty food made the way you want. I always order food here to take away and enjoy at home. love it
author: Pamela F.

description: I've tried and tried and tried. I live near this place, so I have given them the ole' college try  - Repeatedly. Alas, I live right near a taqueria and its useless to me.  The food has NO flavor, and I get the feeling that they are not even listening when you order. You have to repeat several times. And it seems to still end up wrong.
author: Lawrence P. W.

description: let me save you some time and be very concise: it sucks.
author: Tyler C.

description: This is the best NON-Mission SF Burrito. Amazing salsa bar with Green Salsa to die for! Staff is friendly and they make a mean horchata! Very kid friendly. So happy to have a REAL taqueria in the Sunset!
author: Jon B.

description:
My first time there and I was NOT impressed. The Super Veggie Burrito consists of cheese, beans,rice and lettuce. Not very "super veggie" since it only had one vegetable!  Lame.
Salsa has a very odd taste. 
It is a very clean place though.
Also, the main reason for 1 instead of 2 stars: While ordering I received at least 5 eye rolls and 2 sighs from the waitress. Horrible customer service.
author: Tara M.

description: I've only had the chicken quesadilla here, but I like it.  Is it authentic?  I don't care.  It satisfies my craving for fatty, greasy food.  I just wished they delivered.  Oh well, no place can be perfect.
author: Danielle B.

description: 3.5 stars. I got an egg dish that was a little bland but it was a lot of food for the money which was nice. The guy was nice as well but the girl at the cash register was taking her sweet time about everything. My boyfriend got the steak tacos which were actually quite delicious. Definitely not the best Mexican food but it's a quick fix for a taco if you don't want to go all the way to the mission.
author: Catherine C.

description: a decently yummy burrito for an equally decent price.   The horchata was better than the food. The carnitas was ok. I loved the ambiance. Not bad if you're passing by and in need of some meat in your mouth. Then again, there are plenty of places in the city to get meat in your mouth.
author: Kevin L.

description: Can someone please teach me how to eat STEAK in  a PLASTIC KNIFE ??? I need to learn that one.
author: Alex M.

description: Sorry guys, I don't like giving negative reviews but after taking a couple of bites out of a rice and bean burrito with sour cream, cheese and salsa my stomach was tied up in knots for a few hours. The two guys working there didn't seem to understand their own menu. I wanted a rice and bean burrito which is $3.50 or $3.75 (not too sure) and then make it "super" which is an extra $1.50 for cheese, sour cream and salsa added on. They kept telling us to buy a super veggie burrito cause its the same thing and we were debating back and forth until finally we got what we wanted but still ended up getting charged for a super veggie burrito. Too bad. It'd be nice to have a decent local place to grab  food to go when you're in a hurry.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Last Friday was infernally hot in San Francisco. Combined with the curious habit that Enterprise Rent-a-Car has of upgrading my economy car to something ridiculous (the first time it was a PT Cruiser, this time it was a Dodge Ram QuadCab) I had a hankering for piling a bunch of people and firewood into the truck for a good ole beach bonfire. 

I also had about a million errands to run since I'd just gotten back in town that day, so I found myself looking for a burrito, not in the Mission where I was earlier, but out in the Outer Sunset. Someone along the way recommended Beach Burrito so I went to check it out. Good burrito, baaaaaaaaaaaaad service. 

The woman who was taking orders was SOOOOO SLOWWWWWWW. At one point, after being the single person in line for about 5 minutes (and granted, it looked like there were a couple of burritos in the works) I caught her eye and smiled. She smiled back. And then went back to putting chips into paper bags. So I asked one of the nice, but slow, young men making the burritos (honestly this guy couldn't have been more painstaking if he was restoring a Faberge egg) "Is this where I order?" He said, very nicely, "Yes, yes!" and then went back to  gilding the burrito, or whatever the eff he was doing. Then the older man who was cleaning the tables came by and said "I'm so sorry it's taking so long; but the burritos are worth it! They really are!" So cute...so why was no one alerting the Senora that she had a customer? Another guy arrived, stood in line behind me for another 3 minutes, I finally said loudly as the woman walked by me AGAIN "Can I order?" with a giant fake smile on my face. She finally took my order, was rather rude about it, and then I waited 10 minutes for a burrito that could have been made in 2. 

Then when the lady rang me up, she told me the total THEN WALKED AWAY before I could give her the money. The nice old man bussing the tables saw me looking homicidal and came over, but couldn't actually ring me up, so I had to wait for the woman to finish chatting with the burrito-maker-guy and come back and finish ringing me up.

The burrito turned out to be tasty (though the carne asada really reminded me of some sauteed meat dish my mom made when I was little, and mind you, I'm Vietnamese so the spice profile is way different) and the salsa bar, though limited, was good as well. Go here if you are (a) the mellow sort who can wait for things for hours or (b) the ball-breaker kind who will snap that woman to attention.
author: J N.

description: For a quick and huge burrito, the ones here are fantastic. I purchased a super burrito with carnitas and black beans that was enough to fill me up and leave me with a massive food baby. The burrito wasn't super salty which is usually a problem when I eat food like this. $9 well spent!
author: Megan S.

description:
i have only had the fish tacos there and i think they are very good. large chunks of fresh grilled mahi mahi on corn tortillas with chunky "fresh" salsa fresca.  the entire facility is clean and well lit. the salsa bar has a decent selection of very fresh choices.

the kitchen staff doesn't use lard but does use NON-hydrogenated veggie oil to prepare all there dishes.   when i asked about the oils they happily addressed all of my questions with a smile. 

6  visits and counting
author: Playa A.

description: So as I was driving through the sunset to get to the lower haight and I told my friends about this place that makes a great rio bowl.  So with a little convincing that I was not a hippie we ended up at Judahlicious.  But it was closed.  MFer.  I got a special chicken burrito that was not too special at all.  In fact it was a un special chicken burrito.  The only reason this place got two stars was because the bathroom was so clean.  They must have just cleaned it.  I swear it was the cleanest bathroom in a mexican joint I have seen and everybody knows that i love bathrooms in mexican joints...  So to sum it up don't eat here but if you have to take a dump you know where to go....
author: Tito C.

description: Pretty cheap (except for the non-American sodas, which were apparently $3.00 or I was totally ripped off). I thought the staff was very nice and my tacos took about 2 minutes (rice & beans + cheese). A few more chips would have been nice but whatever. The bathroom is clean and colorful like the restaurant.
author: charlotte c.

description: I used to like this place, only because they were better than the atrocious La Playa on Noriega.I'm a neighborhood local. I was just charged $10 for an extremely average carnitas burrito. Don't go unless you really have to have Mexican food. It's basically a rip-off.
author: Tico H.

description: Boring with a white washed feel to it.  I hate it when restaurants cater their menu to what they think a certain percentage of people really want.  If I want a burrito, then I want the real thing.  Don't give me an over-priced burrito with a side of unfriendly service.
author: Mike M.

description: I tried it again.  I must have forgotten.  I tried a burrito this time.  You know when your in a bind and you just don't want to go to the mission this place isn't bad, but it's not good.  It's dry!  But I do like their chill man mascots.
author: amanda v.

description: I enjoy this place for what it is in the sunset;  big comfort food style burritos with tasty salsa. The people behind the counter are friendly and helpful. Is this the best burrito in the city? Nope. Best in the Sunset? Yep. What I like to do is order my burrito to go, and then race over to Celia's across the street and down a block and order a pitcher of margaritas. Its my own version of the outer sunset happy hour.
author: Dustin H.

description: There stuff is pretty good; definitely the best taqueria in the outer sunset.  Like the chile verde chicken a lot, and that is a meat that not a lot of taquerias have.  Basic taco shop food, but tasty and the portions are large.
author: F U.

description: i was at the beach and craving a burrito.  this was nearby.  bad choice, i shouldve gone to 7-11 and gotten a hotdog.  the chicken burrito was bland.  the salsa was bland.  the horchata was powdery.  well, u get the idea....
author: Kris H.

description: How do you screw up a burrito???? I don't know either....but if you just HAVE to know, ask El Beach Burrito.
author: Laurie A.

description: I love Beach Burrito! I've become good friends with Elvira who works there. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I recently had the veggie nachos and I loved them! Its pure vegetarian delight!
author: Marilyn W.

description: I was expecting this place to fail when I had my first burrito here. A decent burrito spot in the Sunset? Seemed like an impossibility. Much to my surprise though it was actually pretty good. I ate there again last night and again was pleasantly surprised. The burrito had been sitting out actually for about 20 minutes after its purchase due to the "session" my friends, girlfriend and I had and it was still good. A lot of burritos would have gotten cold and lost a bit of flavor but Beach Burrito's burrito literally withstood the test of time. I want to say both times I went there were flukes, but it's not going to stop me from going there next time I'm in the area.
author: Dan C.

description: What can I say, I love Mexican food!  I understand this place isn't very authentic, but you know the phrase, "When you have lemons, you make lemonade."  I'm a chips and salsa lover and unfortunately, they are very stingy.  Plus, the lady who works the cash register is very rude.  They overload their burritos with beans and they burritos lack flavor.  I don't recommend this place, but if you're starving, I guess it should suffice.
author: Manton R.

description: It's ok. Their burritos tend to be a small for the price and too dry for my tastes (you're going to want the guacamole and extra salsa) but the entrees are not bad. Can be a bit slow for a taqueria; if you're doing a pick-up for dinner I'd recommend phoning in your order in advance.
author: Nick R.

description:
food was good. burritos big and nachos yummy. 

Being from down south, I'm always a fan of cheap mexican food so my gf and I decided to stop in and grab a bite. The first thing that strikes you is that the place is BIG. It's no hole in the wall I'm used to, but still produced quality food.  Big plus to this place was that their food was all open behind their counter, no shadiness there with who's cooking the food. (you can rest assure that Mexicans are indeed cooking and that's a good thing!)

Our tummys were happy... and then I pooped, a lot.
author: Jeff Y.

description:
This place was terrible.  My girlfriend and I went there and as soon as the server saw us, he started finding things to do to completely ignore us.  He stood right in front of us, no eye contact and refused to take our order or even acknowledge our presence.  The woman from the back saw me and came out only to look at both of us and completely ignore us.  I've never seen such blatant homophobia especially in San Francisco.  

There were no other customers and 3 people working there, all of whom completely ignored us.  I waited about 10 minutes at first assuming they were just busy, but when no one would even make eye contact or speak to us after trying to get their attention, we walked out.  

I strongly recommend NOT going to this establishment.
author: Jen T.

description:
I wouldn't recommend anyone even trying this place.  I didn't like the food and I didn't like the service.  When I ordered my food, I felt like I was bothering the attendants and it was actually pretty expensive.  I got home and was disappointed with everything I bought( a carne asada burrito, stale chips and bland salsa).  If you're in this area and you want Mexican food, then drive up to Geary or over to 9th and Irving and have some Gordo Taqueria, it's worth the drive.
Edit: I gave them another chance and while the food was still a little bland, I definitely changed my mind on this place.  The ingredients were fresh, the help was polite, and it's still right by my house.
author: Chris H.

description: I thought the burrito here was decent. The price decent and the service friendly. I order the beef regular burrito and I like it. Sort of bland, but with the salsa it was decent. You have to get the salsa on the side from the cart. I didn't care for the guac or whatever that green sauce was. It was really watered down. Overall decent place.
author: Leon C.

description: it's okay, if you're into excessively greasy food. The service, while it is designed as a take-out, isn't all that great. And it appears that the employees don't really care about their customers  all that much. BTW, it's overpriced, considering what it is.
author: Roger W.

description: We were looking for something to eat and we already had Sea Breeze so I decided I will get a burrito. Totally an American burrito joint. The burrito was way to expensive I payed like 12 bucks. I ordered Chicken burrito in sauce with Shrimp added. It was not good at all when I took it home to eat. I did not even finish my meal and I ate some of my boyfriends food because he had gotten Sea breeze while I thought I was getting something better. I will not go back there again.
author: Ge I.

description: Gotta stick up for my local burrito place because all the posers and hipsters who slam it clearly don't know anything ABOUT burritos.  This place is great.  It's not quite what you would get at a Mission taqueria but GUESS WHAT kids, it's NOT IN THE MISSION!!  Yes, it's a little pricey--they don't have the access to fresh quality ingredients that Farolito does, sorry.  But it's really good.  I'd recommend the carnitas or the carne asada.  For the non-burritoinos out there, the steak and shrimp quesadilla is without peer.  Anywhere.  So if you don't like it, PLEASE stay away.  The wait in line is long enough as it is!
author: Tony L.

description: Great menu, decent prices.  Everything is pricey in the city so no complaints.  The burritos are great; the quesodillas can be a little messy.  Sometime the guacamole isn't as good as other times but it still passes for good guacamole.
author: Shaun B.

description: I love this place... correction, I crave this place.  Thier Super Tacos are my addiction.
author: Bin M.

description: finally a breakfast buritto i love!!!  i had their chorizo buritto which was delicious! i restrained myself from having 2. ...delish!!!
author: SF Native M.

description:
"The fact that actual Mexicans work and prepare the food it seems very just plain boring."

You are a stupid, stupid person.
author: Person N.

description:
San Francisco is full of great burrito places. This is not one of them.

If you live in the Sunset, stay away from any burrito place west of Sunset Boulevard. El Burrito Express and Gordo's are the only two edible burrito joints in the hood. Actually, you should just suck it up and take a trip to the Mission if you want a burrito.
author: Dean A.

description: Great if you want a burrito in the sunset.  Sure the mission district has some awesome places, but this is a great spot for those of us who don't live so close and want a burrito.  The people who work there are nice and the awesome jalapeno peppers on the will make you want to grow a moustache.  Eat here.  Its great.
author: Ruby G.

description:
sweet spot!  if im not getting chicken tiki masala after a night of drinking than im prolly here getting a burrito...  they have good choices and im pretty fond of the fish burrito myself... its cheaper than most the others and really good... 

me coming from So Cal with all the taco joints down there I have to say I was pretty stoked to find this spot when I did!  Highly recommend it...
author: Anthony Z.

description:
I went there because of the Entertainment coupon. Cashier refused the coupon saying the owner stopped taking the coupon "long ago." 

To top it off - the burrito was bland and had no taste what-so-ever.

Big waste of time and $.
author: D W.

description:
I was so excited to have a taqueria open so close to my house, but after numerous trips I gave up on the hope that it would "get better."

Everything is dry and bland. The meat is dry, the beans are dry, the rice is dry and often partially uncooked. If you're ordering a non-meat burrito, don't expect it to be remotely warm - even if they use the tortilla steamers, it really doesn't make a difference. 

Big disappointment - if you're in the area and absolutely want mexican food, go to Celia's a block away. The food there is much better.
author: Lena B.

description: I have to give this place credit for having a lot of options, as far as burritos go. The grilled tofu was a nice experience, but the rice and beans were totally dry and flavorless. Even doused in salsa and lime, the burrito failed to impress. It may have been a healthy burrito, but when I'm in the mood for a burrito, I'm not in the mood for light and airy-- I'm in the mood for loads of juicy beans, greasy cheese, thick rice, and spicy jalepenos.
author: lizzie r.

description: Good burritos.  Lots of variations.  I'm a burrito freak, so this is perfect for me.  Counter service.  Ordinary atmosphere.  There's not a lot of good simple places in Outer Sunset near the beach, so this is one place you can safely go to and get good comfort mexican food.
author: JA F.

description: I enjoy the super veggie burrito, but the service is horrible.  They're slow and a bit rude.  The salsa bar is not great and the other burritos are okay.  A little overpriced for what it really is.  Nothing special, but if you live near there I recommend calling in your order first.
author: Kate S.

description: Since I practically live at this place some weeks, I feel like I have to write a review.. Oh yes, the homies at El Burrito Beach.. they are an interesting bunch.. We go way back.. well.. to a few months ago when I moved to the City.. but it seems like we have known each other forever.. Why you ask? Well, I'll tell you why.. First of all, every time I come here, they ask me if I speak Spanish.. "Habla espanol?" To which I respond the same way.. every freaking time.. "un poquito".. apparently, there is something about the way I look that screams "this girl is fluent in Spanish", because next thing I know, I am hearing a story about a brothers cousin's uncle who married some bitch that nobody likes and.. damn.. I should just start saying "no, I don't speak Spanish".. It's not like they are going to remember.. Anyway, I find the people who work there to be, though forgetful, very friendly for the most part.. and not as slow as everyone else.. I mean, if you go in there, and there are 10 people in line in front of you, then yeah, it's gonna be a minute.. if you walk up in there, and it's just you.. and it takes 13 and a half minutes to get an order of nachos that should realistically take 2 minutes to make, maybe you should be asking yourself what it is about you that makes these people hate you, and not want you to have your food in a timely manner.. I'm just sayin'.. On to the food! It's okay.. I mean, it's not great.. I find things taste better with black beans, as opposed to pinto or refried.. they have a big menu.. one thing is as good as another.. I mean, honestly, what the fuck do you want?  It's a taqueria in the Sunset for Christs sake, not the Mission.. Bottom line.. if you are a Sunsetter like me, and you are craving a burrito, this place does the job..
author: Francesca L.

description: when burritos are your comfort food- just put extra cheese in it.  pretty speedy.  it's a convenient place and a nice break from the crazy mission mexican places!
author: Monk R.

description: I was SO in the mood for a burrito, but way too lazy to drive anywhere, so this is where I ended up... with a carne asada burrito that was just ok.  Very boring, with way too much refried beans that I couldn't taste the meat.  Boo to this place, but it IS only 1 of 2 taquerias way out here.  Next time, I'll get a real burrito or have something else instead.
author: Christine H.

description: Not the best burrito, but if you are looking for some quick and inexpensive Mexican food way out in the Sunset, this is the place.
author: Will C.

description: We all know that the Mission has some tasty mexican food, but I have to say that El Beach Burrito is an amazing establishment and a shining beacon in the fog of the Outer Sunset.  I usually get the Super Carnitas Burrito, that's been my thing lately.  The place is clean, the staff is pleasant and quick, the salsa bar has great red and green options.  If you are looking for some dependable grubbing while out at the beach, hit this place up.
author: Sean S.

description: The food was blah and the people were kinda rude, they had a salsa bar which is the only plus...
author: Daniel S.

description: Going to the beach makes me so hungry.  I've been trying to let go of the craving for bologna and cheese sandwiches left over from too many childhood beach picnics, and this place is helping me get through.  After a couple hours walking around on the beach, I can go up here and down a super veggie burrito.  And that's all I'll ever need to order here.  I can't speak for the other items on the menu, but that's one thing that they do right.
author: eh k.

description: El Beach Burrito is an overpriced burrito place with crummy service and below-par burritos. The salsa leaves a lot to be desired, and they just throw a handful of chips right into the bag with the burrito instead of giving it a separate bag. I mean, 7 dollars for that? It's not really worth it, and they don't make up for it with service, routinely confusing orders and being impolite. I wouldn't go here unless you really need a burrito.
author: Will R.

description: so this is an average burrito joint- i don't know what everyone else is expecting. for being out in the middle of BFE san fran it does the trick. if you think the food is bland throw some salsa on the mo fo. the staff has always been polite and it has never taken more than 5 minutes for them to whip up the standard rig.
author: K M.
